Introduction

Scholars@TAMU is a profile system that hosts searchable expertise for faculty and TAMU organizations by gathering data from institution-level/enterprise systems, publicly available research data (e.g., grants and publications), and other authoritative sources. The data is compiled into a profile that you can edit to best represent your scholarship and expertise.

This system helps to:

  • Improve the discoverability of scholarly expertise

  • Enhance the scholarly identity of researchers

  • Facilitate new research collaborations.

1. Discovery

1.1. Collections

1.1.1. Page

This provides a page of all the collections present in the system, based on the request parameters as shown.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+page+

The page number.

+size+

The page size.

+sort+

The page sort [field,asc/desc].
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+_embedded.individual+

+Array+

An array of Collection resources.

+_links+

+Object+

Links to other resources.

+page+

+Object+

Page details for Collection resources.

+facets+

+Array+

Facets for Collection resources.

+highlights+

+Array+

Highlights for Collection resources.
Sample Request
GET /individual?page=0&size=10&sort=id HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 97325

    }, {
      "id" : "n284161SE",
      "class" : "Document",
      "title" : "Cascade industrial VSI gives medium voltage-a case study",
      "abstract" : "In this paper, the modularity concept applied to medium-voltage adjustable speed drives (MV-ASD) is addressed. First, the single-phase cascaded (SC) VSI that uses series connection of IGBT H-bridge modules with isolated DC-buses is presented. Next, a novel triphase cascaded (TC) VSI that uses three IGBT triphase inverter modules along with an output transformer to obtain a 3 p.u. multilevel output voltage is introduced. The system yields a high-quality multistep voltage with up to 4 levels and low dv/dt, balanced operation of the inverter modules that supply each a third of the motor kVA. The concept of using TC-VSI is further extended to a new modular motor-modular inverter (MM-MI) system where the MV motor winding connections are reconnected into several three-phase groups, either six-lead or twelve-lead connection according to the voltage height, each powered by a standard triphase IGBT inverter module. Thus a high fault-tolerance is being achieved and the output transformer requirement is eliminated. A staggered space vector modulation (SSVM) technique applicable to triphase cascaded VSI topologies is also demonstrated. Both TC-VSI and MM-MI computer simulations and experimental tests demonstrate the feasibility of the systems",
      "authors" : [ {
        "id" : "n66ebcf36",
        "label" : "Enjeti, Prasad",
        "organizations" : [ {
          "id" : "n2478ed4a",
          "label" : "Electrical and Computer Engineering"
        } ]
      } ],
      "publicationDate" : "Fri Dec 31 00:00:00 UTC 1999",
      "keywords" : [ "Invertors<br />Igbt H-bridge Modules<br />Igbt Triphase Inverter Modules<br />Mv Motor Winding Connections<br />Cascade Industrial Vsi<br />Computer Simulation<br />Experimental Tests<br />Fault-tolerance<br />High-quality Multistep Voltage<br />Isolated Dc-buses<br />Medium-voltage Adjustable Speed Drives<br />Output Transformer<br />Series Connection<br />Staggered Space Vector Modulation" ],

    }, {
      "id" : "n348584SE",
      "class" : "Document",
      "title" : "Evidence for chicken GH as the only hypophyseal factor responsible for the stimulation of hepatic 5'-monodeiodination activity in the chick embryo",
      "abstract" : "The influence of an intravenous injection of chicken growth hormone (cGH), a total chicken pars distalis (PD) extract, and a PD extract depleted of cGH by immunoadsorption was studied in the 18-d-old chick embryo. Plasma concentrations of triiodothyronine (T3), thyroxine (T4), and hepatic 5'-monodeiodination (5'-D) activity were measured. An injection of total PD extract raised plasma T3, T4, and 5'-D activity, whereas a PD extract depleted of GH only increased plasma T4. The amount of cGH present in the PD extracts, as measured by homologous cGH radioimmunoassay, increased T3 and raised liver 5'-D, but had no effect on plasma T4. The effect on liver 5'-D was more pronounced with cGH than with a total PD extract, whereas the effect on plasma T3 was somewhat less pronounced. It was concluded that cGH increased the peripheral conversion of T4 into T3 in the chick embryo, whereas a PD extract depleted of cGH was purely thyrotropic. The PD extract also seemed to have 5'-D-suppressing activity.",

          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n3e016f20"
        }
      }
    } ]
  },
  "_links" : {
    "first" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual?page=1&size=10&sort=id,asc"
    },
    "self" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual"
    },
    "next" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual?page=2&size=10&sort=id,asc"
    },
    "last" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual?page=3&size=10&sort=id,asc"
    },
    "profile" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/profile/individual"
    },
    "search" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/search"
    }
  },
  "facets" : [ ],
  "highlights" : [ ],
  "page" : {
    "size" : 10,
    "totalElements" : 21,
    "totalPages" : 3,
    "number" : 1
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual?page=0&size=10&sort=id' -i -X GET

1.1.2. Find by id

This will find an collection based on the individual id provided as a parameter as shown in Path Parameters. The json response will have the specific collection as shown in the Sample Response.

Path Parameters
Table 1. /individual/{id}
Parameter Description

+id+

The Collection id.
Sample Request
GET /individual/n2052-1537ISSN HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 975

{
  "id" : "n2052-1537ISSN",
  "class" : "Collection",
  "name" : "Materials Chemistry Frontiers",
  "publicationVenueFor" : [ {
    "id" : "n387522SE",
    "label" : "Cost-effective synthesis and solution processing of porous polymer networks through methanesulfonic acid-mediated aldol triple condensation"
  }, {
    "id" : "n384185SE",
    "label" : "A flexible thioether-based MOF as a crystalline sponge for structural characterization of liquid organic molecules"
  }, {
    "id" : "n385038SE",
    "label" : "Co-assembly of sugar-based amphiphilic block polymers to achieve nanoparticles with tunable morphology, size, surface charge, and acid-responsive behavior"
  } ],
  "issn" : "2052-1537",
  "type" : [ "Journal" ],
  "modTime" : "Fri Mar 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",
  "_links" : {
    "self" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n2052-1537ISSN"
    },
    "individual" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n2052-1537ISSN"
    }
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/n2052-1537ISSN' -i -X GET

1.1.3. Find by id In

This will find a list of collections based on the individual ids provided as a parameter as shown in Request Parameters. The json response will have the list of collections as shown in the Sample Response.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+ids+

The Collection ids.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/findByIdIn?ids=n0166-4328ISSN%2Cn0029-6635ISSN%2Cn2052-1537ISSN HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 8875

CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/findByIdIn?ids=n0166-4328ISSN%2Cn0029-6635ISSN%2Cn2052-1537ISSN' -i -X GET

1.1.4. Search

This search will return a json response listing all the collections, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+q+

The search query.

+df+

The default search field.

+facets+

The facet fields.

+type.limit+

Type facet limit.

+type.offset+

Type facet offset.

+type.sort+

Type facet sort {index/count}.

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.

+page+

The page number.

+size+

The page size.

+sort+

The page sort field,{asc/desc}.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+_embedded.individual+

+Array+

An array of Collection resources.

+_links+

+Object+

Links to other resources.

+page+

+Object+

Page details for Collection resources.

+facets+

+Array+

Facets for Collection resources.

+highlights+

+Array+

Highlights for Collection resources.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/advanced?q=*%3A*&df=_text_&facets=type&type.limit=5&type.offset=0&type.sort=COUNT&filters=class&class.filter=Collection&page=0&size=20&sort=id HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 9777

{
  "_embedded" : {
    "individual" : [ {
      "id" : "n0029-6635ISSN",

        "label" : "Testicular hormones do not regulate sexually dimorphic Pavlovian fear conditioning or perforant-path long-term potentiation in adult male rats"
      }, {

      "issn" : "0166-4328",
      "type" : [ "Journal" ],
      "modTime" : "Fri Feb 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",
      "_links" : {
        "self" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n0166-4328ISSN"

      "id" : "n2052-1537ISSN",

          "templated" : true
        },
        "export" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n2052-1537ISSN/export?type=docx"
        }
      }
    } ]
  },
  "_links" : {
    "self" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/search/advanced?page=1&size=20&sort=id,asc"
    }
  },
  "facets" : [ {
    "field" : "type",
    "entries" : {
      "content" : [ {
        "value" : "journal",
        "count" : 3,
        "valueKey" : "journal"
      } ],
      "page" : {
        "size" : 10,
        "totalElements" : 1,
        "totalPages" : 1,
        "number" : 1
      }
    }
  } ],
  "highlights" : [ ],
  "page" : {
    "size" : 20,
    "totalElements" : 3,
    "totalPages" : 1,
    "number" : 1
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/advanced?q=*%3A*&df=_text_&facets=type&type.limit=5&type.offset=0&type.sort=COUNT&filters=class&class.filter=Collection&page=0&size=20&sort=id' -i -X GET

1.1.5. Export Search

This export will return a stream of specified type containing the search results with the requested fields, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+query+

The search query

+type+

The search export format type

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.

+export+

The search export fields
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/export?query=*&type=csv&filters=class&class.filter=Collection&export=id%2CId&export=type%2CType&export=individual%2CIndividual HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Disposition: attachment; filename=export.csv
Content-Type: text/csv
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 227

Id,Type,Individual
n0029-6635ISSN,Journal,http://localhost:4200/display/n0029-6635ISSN
n0166-4328ISSN,Journal,http://localhost:4200/display/n0166-4328ISSN
n2052-1537ISSN,Journal,http://localhost:4200/display/n2052-1537ISSN
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/export?query=*&type=csv&filters=class&class.filter=Collection&export=id%2CId&export=type%2CType&export=individual%2CIndividual' -i -X GET

1.1.6. Export Single Page

This export will return a stream of specified type containing the single page built from the associated export view. An export view must be added to the display view for the type of collection.

Path Parameters
Table 2. /individual/{id}/export
Parameter Description

+id+

The individual id
Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+type+

The single page export format type
Sample Request
GET /individual/n0166-4328ISSN/export?type=docx HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/n0166-4328ISSN/export?type=docx' -i -X GET

1.1.7. Count

This count will return a json response containing the count, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+q+

The search query.

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+value+

+Number+

The resulting count.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/count?q=*%3A*&filters=class&class.filter=Collection HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 17

{
  "value" : 3
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/count?q=*%3A*&filters=class&class.filter=Collection' -i -X GET

1.1.8. Recently Updated

This will return a json response listing recently updated collections, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+limit+

The number of recently updated documents to return.

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+_embedded.individual+

+Array+

An array of Collection resources.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/recentlyUpdated?limit=2&filters=class&class.filter=Collection HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 6396

1.2. Concepts

1.2.1. Page

This provides a page of all the concepts present in the system, based on the request parameters as shown.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+page+

The page number.

+size+

The page size.

+sort+

The page sort [field,asc/desc].
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+_embedded.individual+

+Array+

An array of Concept resources.

+_links+

+Object+

Links to other resources.

+page+

+Object+

Page details for Concept resources.

+facets+

+Array+

Facets for Concept resources.

+highlights+

+Array+

Highlights for Concept resources.
Sample Request
GET /individual?page=0&size=10&sort=id HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 97325

    }, {
      "id" : "n284161SE",
      "class" : "Document",
      "title" : "Cascade industrial VSI gives medium voltage-a case study",
      "abstract" : "In this paper, the modularity concept applied to medium-voltage adjustable speed drives (MV-ASD) is addressed. First, the single-phase cascaded (SC) VSI that uses series connection of IGBT H-bridge modules with isolated DC-buses is presented. Next, a novel triphase cascaded (TC) VSI that uses three IGBT triphase inverter modules along with an output transformer to obtain a 3 p.u. multilevel output voltage is introduced. The system yields a high-quality multistep voltage with up to 4 levels and low dv/dt, balanced operation of the inverter modules that supply each a third of the motor kVA. The concept of using TC-VSI is further extended to a new modular motor-modular inverter (MM-MI) system where the MV motor winding connections are reconnected into several three-phase groups, either six-lead or twelve-lead connection according to the voltage height, each powered by a standard triphase IGBT inverter module. Thus a high fault-tolerance is being achieved and the output transformer requirement is eliminated. A staggered space vector modulation (SSVM) technique applicable to triphase cascaded VSI topologies is also demonstrated. Both TC-VSI and MM-MI computer simulations and experimental tests demonstrate the feasibility of the systems",
      "authors" : [ {
        "id" : "n66ebcf36",
        "label" : "Enjeti, Prasad",
        "organizations" : [ {
          "id" : "n2478ed4a",
          "label" : "Electrical and Computer Engineering"
        } ]
      } ],
      "publicationDate" : "Fri Dec 31 00:00:00 UTC 1999",

    }, {
      "id" : "n348584SE",
      "class" : "Document",
      "title" : "Evidence for chicken GH as the only hypophyseal factor responsible for the stimulation of hepatic 5'-monodeiodination activity in the chick embryo",
      "abstract" : "The influence of an intravenous injection of chicken growth hormone (cGH), a total chicken pars distalis (PD) extract, and a PD extract depleted of cGH by immunoadsorption was studied in the 18-d-old chick embryo. Plasma concentrations of triiodothyronine (T3), thyroxine (T4), and hepatic 5'-monodeiodination (5'-D) activity were measured. An injection of total PD extract raised plasma T3, T4, and 5'-D activity, whereas a PD extract depleted of GH only increased plasma T4. The amount of cGH present in the PD extracts, as measured by homologous cGH radioimmunoassay, increased T3 and raised liver 5'-D, but had no effect on plasma T4. The effect on liver 5'-D was more pronounced with cGH than with a total PD extract, whereas the effect on plasma T3 was somewhat less pronounced. It was concluded that cGH increased the peripheral conversion of T4 into T3 in the chick embryo, whereas a PD extract depleted of cGH was purely thyrotropic. The PD extract also seemed to have 5'-D-suppressing activity.",
      "publicationVenue" : {
        "id" : "n0181-1916ISSN",
        "label" : "Reproduction Nutrition Development"

      "overview" : "Research areas focus on acquiring fundamental new knowledge of the avian immune system and applying this new knowledge toward the development  of new immuno-biotechnological tools.  Research projects include the study of the immune response in the chicken, especially the function of antigen presenting cells (such as the dendritic cells) in activating the humeral immune response and the development of chicken egg yolk antibodies, monoclonal antibodies and recombinant antibodies for diagnostic, prophylactic and therapeutic purposes. Dr. Berghman was the recipient of the 2016 Zoetis Fundamental Science Award.",

          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n3e016f20"
        }
      }
    } ]
  },
  "_links" : {
    "first" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual?page=1&size=10&sort=id,asc"
    },
    "self" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual"
    },
    "next" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual?page=2&size=10&sort=id,asc"
    },
    "last" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual?page=3&size=10&sort=id,asc"
    },
    "profile" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/profile/individual"
    },
    "search" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/search"
    }
  },
  "facets" : [ ],
  "highlights" : [ ],
  "page" : {
    "size" : 10,
    "totalElements" : 21,
    "totalPages" : 3,
    "number" : 1
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual?page=0&size=10&sort=id' -i -X GET

1.2.2. Find by id

This will find an concept based on the individual id provided as a parameter as shown in Path Parameters. The json response will have the specific concept as shown in the Sample Response.

Path Parameters
Table 3. /individual/{id}
Parameter Description

+id+

The Concept id.
Sample Request
GET /individual/nfst01015913 HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 765

{
  "id" : "nfst01015913",
  "class" : "Concept",
  "name" : "Memory",
  "associatedDepartments" : [ {
    "id" : "n5d5efcc4",
    "label" : "Neuroscience and Experimental Therapeutics"
  }, {
    "id" : "naaf1953a",
    "label" : "Center for Health Systems and Design"
  }, {
    "id" : "n699ce527",
    "label" : "College of Nursing"
  } ],
  "researchAreaOf" : [ {
    "id" : "nd08ea40b",
    "label" : "Dormire, Sharon"
  }, {
    "id" : "nc5b013b5",
    "label" : "Montgomery, Karienn"
  } ],
  "type" : [ "Concept" ],
  "modTime" : "Tue Jan 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",
  "_links" : {
    "self" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/nfst01015913"
    },
    "individual" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/nfst01015913"
    }
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/nfst01015913' -i -X GET

1.2.3. Find by id In

This will find a list of concepts based on the individual ids provided as a parameter as shown in Request Parameters. The json response will have the list of concepts as shown in the Sample Response.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+ids+

The Concept ids.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/findByIdIn?ids=nfst00867172%2Cnfst01785961%2Cnfst01015913 HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 2754

{
  "_embedded" : {
    "individual" : [ {

    "self" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/search/findByIdIn"
    }
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/findByIdIn?ids=nfst00867172%2Cnfst01785961%2Cnfst01015913' -i -X GET

1.2.4. Search

This search will return a json response listing all the concepts, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+q+

The search query.

+df+

The default search field.

+facets+

The facet fields.

+type.limit+

Type facet limit.

+type.offset+

Type facet offset.

+type.sort+

Type facet sort {index/count}.

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.

+page+

The page number.

+size+

The page size.

+sort+

The page sort field,{asc/desc}.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+_embedded.individual+

+Array+

An array of Concept resources.

+_links+

+Object+

Links to other resources.

+page+

+Object+

Page details for Concept resources.

+facets+

+Array+

Facets for Concept resources.

+highlights+

+Array+

Highlights for Concept resources.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/advanced?q=*%3A*&df=_text_&facets=type&type.limit=5&type.offset=0&type.sort=COUNT&filters=class&class.filter=Concept&page=0&size=20&sort=id HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 3656

{
  "_embedded" : {
    "individual" : [ {
      "id" : "nfst00867172",
      "class" : "Concept",
      "name" : "Collection development (Libraries)",
      "associatedDepartments" : [ {
        "id" : "nb7f16f5c",
        "label" : "University Libraries"
      } ],
      "researchAreaOf" : [ {
        "id" : "nb3f90c0a",
        "label" : "Tabacaru, Simona"
      }, {
        "id" : "nfc5401e7",
        "label" : "Hubbard, David"
      } ],
      "type" : [ "Concept" ],
      "modTime" : "Fri Feb 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",
      "_links" : {
        "self" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/nfst00867172"
        },
        "individual" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual{?page,size,sort}",
          "templated" : true
        },
        "export" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/nfst00867172/export?type=docx"
        }
      }
    }, {
      "id" : "nfst01015913",
      "class" : "Concept",
      "name" : "Memory",
      "associatedDepartments" : [ {
        "id" : "n5d5efcc4",
        "label" : "Neuroscience and Experimental Therapeutics"
      }, {
        "id" : "naaf1953a",
        "label" : "Center for Health Systems and Design"
      }, {
        "id" : "n699ce527",

      } ],

      "modTime" : "Tue Jan 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",

        "self" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/nfst01015913"
        },
        "individual" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual{?page,size,sort}",
          "templated" : true
        },
        "export" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/nfst01015913/export?type=docx"
        }
      }
    }, {
      "id" : "nfst01785961",
      "class" : "Concept",
      "name" : "Legal research and writing",
      "associatedDepartments" : [ {
        "id" : "n52ff53af",
        "label" : "School of Law"
      } ],
      "researchAreaOf" : [ {
        "id" : "n18ba7576",
        "label" : "Pauli, Carol"
      }, {
        "id" : "ne72b58ac",
        "label" : "Morrison, Angela"
      }, {
        "id" : "n2e197d6c",
        "label" : "Murphy, John"
      }, {
        "id" : "n0dc318bc",
        "label" : "Sobol, Neil"
      }, {
        "id" : "n9eff5fdc",
        "label" : "Rich, Lisa"
      }, {
        "id" : "n87070ba0",
        "label" : "Pierce, Tanya"
      } ],
      "type" : [ "Concept" ],
      "modTime" : "Fri Mar 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",
      "_links" : {
        "self" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/nfst01785961"
        },
        "individual" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual{?page,size,sort}",
          "templated" : true
        },
        "export" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/nfst01785961/export?type=docx"
        }
      }
    } ]
  },
  "_links" : {
    "self" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/search/advanced?page=1&size=20&sort=id,asc"
    }
  },
  "facets" : [ {
    "field" : "type",
    "entries" : {
      "content" : [ {
        "value" : "concept",
        "count" : 3,
        "valueKey" : "concept"
      } ],
      "page" : {
        "size" : 10,
        "totalElements" : 1,
        "totalPages" : 1,
        "number" : 1
      }
    }
  } ],
  "highlights" : [ ],
  "page" : {
    "size" : 20,
    "totalElements" : 3,
    "totalPages" : 1,
    "number" : 1
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/advanced?q=*%3A*&df=_text_&facets=type&type.limit=5&type.offset=0&type.sort=COUNT&filters=class&class.filter=Concept&page=0&size=20&sort=id' -i -X GET

1.2.5. Export Search

This export will return a stream of specified type containing the search results with the requested fields, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+query+

The search query

+type+

The search export format type

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.

+export+

The search export fields
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/export?query=*&type=csv&filters=class&class.filter=Concept&export=id%2CId&export=type%2CType&export=individual%2CIndividual HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Disposition: attachment; filename=export.csv
Content-Type: text/csv
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 215

Id,Type,Individual
nfst00867172,Concept,http://localhost:4200/display/nfst00867172
nfst01015913,Concept,http://localhost:4200/display/nfst01015913
nfst01785961,Concept,http://localhost:4200/display/nfst01785961
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/export?query=*&type=csv&filters=class&class.filter=Concept&export=id%2CId&export=type%2CType&export=individual%2CIndividual' -i -X GET

1.2.6. Export Single Page

This export will return a stream of specified type containing the single page built from the associated export view. An export view must be added to the display view for the type of concept.

Path Parameters
Table 4. /individual/{id}/export
Parameter Description

+id+

The individual id
Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+type+

The single page export format type
Sample Request
GET /individual/nfst00867172/export?type=docx HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/nfst00867172/export?type=docx' -i -X GET

1.2.7. Count

This count will return a json response containing the count, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+q+

The search query.

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+value+

+Number+

The resulting count.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/count?q=*%3A*&filters=class&class.filter=Concept HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 17

{
  "value" : 3
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/count?q=*%3A*&filters=class&class.filter=Concept' -i -X GET

1.2.8. Recently Updated

This will return a json response listing recently updated concepts, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+limit+

The number of recently updated documents to return.

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+_embedded.individual+

+Array+

An array of Concept resources.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/recentlyUpdated?limit=2&filters=class&class.filter=Concept HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 2054

1.3. Documents

1.3.1. Page

This provides a page of all the documents present in the system, based on the request parameters as shown.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+page+

The page number.

+size+

The page size.

+sort+

The page sort [field,asc/desc].
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+_embedded.individual+

+Array+

An array of Document resources.

+_links+

+Object+

Links to other resources.

+page+

+Object+

Page details for Document resources.

+facets+

+Array+

Facets for Document resources.

+highlights+

+Array+

Highlights for Document resources.
Sample Request
GET /individual?page=0&size=10&sort=id HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 97325

    }, {
      "id" : "n284161SE",
      "class" : "Document",
      "title" : "Cascade industrial VSI gives medium voltage-a case study",
      "abstract" : "In this paper, the modularity concept applied to medium-voltage adjustable speed drives (MV-ASD) is addressed. First, the single-phase cascaded (SC) VSI that uses series connection of IGBT H-bridge modules with isolated DC-buses is presented. Next, a novel triphase cascaded (TC) VSI that uses three IGBT triphase inverter modules along with an output transformer to obtain a 3 p.u. multilevel output voltage is introduced. The system yields a high-quality multistep voltage with up to 4 levels and low dv/dt, balanced operation of the inverter modules that supply each a third of the motor kVA. The concept of using TC-VSI is further extended to a new modular motor-modular inverter (MM-MI) system where the MV motor winding connections are reconnected into several three-phase groups, either six-lead or twelve-lead connection according to the voltage height, each powered by a standard triphase IGBT inverter module. Thus a high fault-tolerance is being achieved and the output transformer requirement is eliminated. A staggered space vector modulation (SSVM) technique applicable to triphase cascaded VSI topologies is also demonstrated. Both TC-VSI and MM-MI computer simulations and experimental tests demonstrate the feasibility of the systems",
      "authors" : [ {
        "id" : "n66ebcf36",
        "label" : "Enjeti, Prasad",
        "organizations" : [ {
          "id" : "n2478ed4a",
          "label" : "Electrical and Computer Engineering"
        } ]
      } ],
      "publicationDate" : "Fri Dec 31 00:00:00 UTC 1999",

    }, {
      "id" : "n348584SE",
      "class" : "Document",
      "title" : "Evidence for chicken GH as the only hypophyseal factor responsible for the stimulation of hepatic 5'-monodeiodination activity in the chick embryo",
      "abstract" : "The influence of an intravenous injection of chicken growth hormone (cGH), a total chicken pars distalis (PD) extract, and a PD extract depleted of cGH by immunoadsorption was studied in the 18-d-old chick embryo. Plasma concentrations of triiodothyronine (T3), thyroxine (T4), and hepatic 5'-monodeiodination (5'-D) activity were measured. An injection of total PD extract raised plasma T3, T4, and 5'-D activity, whereas a PD extract depleted of GH only increased plasma T4. The amount of cGH present in the PD extracts, as measured by homologous cGH radioimmunoassay, increased T3 and raised liver 5'-D, but had no effect on plasma T4. The effect on liver 5'-D was more pronounced with cGH than with a total PD extract, whereas the effect on plasma T3 was somewhat less pronounced. It was concluded that cGH increased the peripheral conversion of T4 into T3 in the chick embryo, whereas a PD extract depleted of cGH was purely thyrotropic. The PD extract also seemed to have 5'-D-suppressing activity.",

    "number" : 1
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual?page=0&size=10&sort=id' -i -X GET

1.3.2. Find by id

This will find an document based on the individual id provided as a parameter as shown in Path Parameters. The json response will have the specific document as shown in the Sample Response.

Path Parameters
Table 5. /individual/{id}
Parameter Description

+id+

The Document id.
Sample Request
GET /individual/n348584SE HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 2243

{
  "id" : "n348584SE",
  "class" : "Document",
  "title" : "Evidence for chicken GH as the only hypophyseal factor responsible for the stimulation of hepatic 5'-monodeiodination activity in the chick embryo",
  "abstract" : "The influence of an intravenous injection of chicken growth hormone (cGH), a total chicken pars distalis (PD) extract, and a PD extract depleted of cGH by immunoadsorption was studied in the 18-d-old chick embryo. Plasma concentrations of triiodothyronine (T3), thyroxine (T4), and hepatic 5'-monodeiodination (5'-D) activity were measured. An injection of total PD extract raised plasma T3, T4, and 5'-D activity, whereas a PD extract depleted of GH only increased plasma T4. The amount of cGH present in the PD extracts, as measured by homologous cGH radioimmunoassay, increased T3 and raised liver 5'-D, but had no effect on plasma T4. The effect on liver 5'-D was more pronounced with cGH than with a total PD extract, whereas the effect on plasma T3 was somewhat less pronounced. It was concluded that cGH increased the peripheral conversion of T4 into T3 in the chick embryo, whereas a PD extract depleted of cGH was purely thyrotropic. The PD extract also seemed to have 5'-D-suppressing activity.",
  "publicationVenue" : {
    "id" : "n0181-1916ISSN",
    "label" : "Reproduction Nutrition Development"
  },
  "authors" : [ {
    "id" : "n3e016f20",
    "label" : "Berghman, Luc",
    "organizations" : [ {
      "id" : "n3af9f727",
      "label" : "Veterinary Pathobiology"
    }, {
      "id" : "nf479a540",
      "label" : "Poultry Science"
    } ]
  } ],
  "publicationDate" : "Sat Dec 31 00:00:00 UTC 1988",
  "keywords" : [ "Animals<br />Chick Embryo<br />Growth Hormone<br />Iodide Peroxidase<br />Liver<br />Thyroxine<br />Tissue Extracts<br />Triiodothyronine" ],
  "pmcid" : "2757759",
  "identifier" : "348584SE",
  "doi" : "10.1051/rnd:19890207",
  "pageStart" : "197",
  "pageEnd" : "202",
  "volume" : "29",
  "issue" : "2",
  "type" : [ "AcademicArticle" ],
  "modTime" : "Fri Mar 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",
  "_links" : {
    "self" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n348584SE"
    },
    "individual" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n348584SE"
    }
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/n348584SE' -i -X GET

1.3.3. Find by id In

This will find a list of documents based on the individual ids provided as a parameter as shown in Request Parameters. The json response will have the list of documents as shown in the Sample Response.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+ids+

The Document ids.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/findByIdIn?ids=n284161SE%2Cn313910SE%2Cn348584SE HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 6235

{
  "_embedded" : {
    "individual" : [ {
      "id" : "n284161SE",
      "class" : "Document",
      "title" : "Cascade industrial VSI gives medium voltage-a case study",
      "abstract" : "In this paper, the modularity concept applied to medium-voltage adjustable speed drives (MV-ASD) is addressed. First, the single-phase cascaded (SC) VSI that uses series connection of IGBT H-bridge modules with isolated DC-buses is presented. Next, a novel triphase cascaded (TC) VSI that uses three IGBT triphase inverter modules along with an output transformer to obtain a 3 p.u. multilevel output voltage is introduced. The system yields a high-quality multistep voltage with up to 4 levels and low dv/dt, balanced operation of the inverter modules that supply each a third of the motor kVA. The concept of using TC-VSI is further extended to a new modular motor-modular inverter (MM-MI) system where the MV motor winding connections are reconnected into several three-phase groups, either six-lead or twelve-lead connection according to the voltage height, each powered by a standard triphase IGBT inverter module. Thus a high fault-tolerance is being achieved and the output transformer requirement is eliminated. A staggered space vector modulation (SSVM) technique applicable to triphase cascaded VSI topologies is also demonstrated. Both TC-VSI and MM-MI computer simulations and experimental tests demonstrate the feasibility of the systems",
      "authors" : [ {
        "id" : "n66ebcf36",
        "label" : "Enjeti, Prasad",
        "organizations" : [ {
          "id" : "n2478ed4a",
          "label" : "Electrical and Computer Engineering"
        } ]
      } ],
      "publicationDate" : "Fri Dec 31 00:00:00 UTC 1999",
      "keywords" : [ "Invertors<br />Igbt H-bridge Modules<br />Igbt Triphase Inverter Modules<br />Mv Motor Winding Connections<br />Cascade Industrial Vsi<br />Computer Simulation<br />Experimental Tests<br />Fault-tolerance<br />High-quality Multistep Voltage<br />Isolated Dc-buses<br />Medium-voltage Adjustable Speed Drives<br />Output Transformer<br />Series Connection<br />Staggered Space Vector Modulation" ],

The effect on liver 5'-D was more pronounced with cGH than with a total PD extract, whereas the effect on plasma T3 was somewhat less pronounced. It was concluded that cGH increased the peripheral conversion of T4 into T3 in the chick embryo, whereas a PD extract depleted of cGH was purely thyrotropic. The PD extract also seemed to have 5'-D-suppressing activity.",

CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/findByIdIn?ids=n284161SE%2Cn313910SE%2Cn348584SE' -i -X GET

1.3.4. Search

This search will return a json response listing all the documents, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+q+

The search query.

+df+

The default search field.

+facets+

The facet fields.

+type.limit+

Type facet limit.

+type.offset+

Type facet offset.

+type.sort+

Type facet sort {index/count}.

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.

+page+

The page number.

+size+

The page size.

+sort+

The page sort field,{asc/desc}.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+_embedded.individual+

+Array+

An array of Document resources.

+_links+

+Object+

Links to other resources.

+page+

+Object+

Page details for Document resources.

+facets+

+Array+

Facets for Document resources.

+highlights+

+Array+

Highlights for Document resources.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/advanced?q=*%3A*&df=_text_&facets=type&type.limit=5&type.offset=0&type.sort=COUNT&filters=class&class.filter=Document&page=0&size=20&sort=id HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 7261

{
  "_embedded" : {
    "individual" : [ {
      "id" : "n284161SE",
      "class" : "Document",
      "title" : "Cascade industrial VSI gives medium voltage-a case study",
      "abstract" : "In this paper, the modularity concept applied to medium-voltage adjustable speed drives (MV-ASD) is addressed. First, the single-phase cascaded (SC) VSI that uses series connection of IGBT H-bridge modules with isolated DC-buses is presented. Next, a novel triphase cascaded (TC) VSI that uses three IGBT triphase inverter modules along with an output transformer to obtain a 3 p.u. multilevel output voltage is introduced. The system yields a high-quality multistep voltage with up to 4 levels and low dv/dt, balanced operation of the inverter modules that supply each a third of the motor kVA. The concept of using TC-VSI is further extended to a new modular motor-modular inverter (MM-MI) system where the MV motor winding connections are reconnected into several three-phase groups, either six-lead or twelve-lead connection according to the voltage height, each powered by a standard triphase IGBT inverter module. Thus a high fault-tolerance is being achieved and the output transformer requirement is eliminated. A staggered space vector modulation (SSVM) technique applicable to triphase cascaded VSI topologies is also demonstrated. Both TC-VSI and MM-MI computer simulations and experimental tests demonstrate the feasibility of the systems",

        "id" : "n66ebcf36",

      }
    }, {
      "id" : "n348584SE",
      "class" : "Document",
      "title" : "Evidence for chicken GH as the only hypophyseal factor responsible for the stimulation of hepatic 5'-monodeiodination activity in the chick embryo",
      "abstract" : "The influence of an intravenous injection of chicken growth hormone (cGH), a total chicken pars distalis (PD) extract, and a PD extract depleted of cGH by immunoadsorption was studied in the 18-d-old chick embryo. Plasma concentrations of triiodothyronine (T3), thyroxine (T4), and hepatic 5'-monodeiodination (5'-D) activity were measured. An injection of total PD extract raised plasma T3, T4, and 5'-D activity, whereas a PD extract depleted of GH only increased plasma T4. The amount of cGH present in the PD extracts, as measured by homologous cGH radioimmunoassay, increased T3 and raised liver 5'-D, but had no effect on plasma T4. The effect on liver 5'-D was more pronounced with cGH than with a total PD extract, whereas the effect on plasma T3 was somewhat less pronounced. It was concluded that cGH increased the peripheral conversion of T4 into T3 in the chick embryo, whereas a PD extract depleted of cGH was purely thyrotropic. The PD extract also seemed to have 5'-D-suppressing activity.",
      "publicationVenue" : {
        "id" : "n0181-1916ISSN",
        "label" : "Reproduction Nutrition Development"
      },
      "authors" : [ {
        "id" : "n3e016f20",
        "label" : "Berghman, Luc",
        "organizations" : [ {
          "id" : "n3af9f727",
          "label" : "Veterinary Pathobiology"
        }, {
          "id" : "nf479a540",
          "label" : "Poultry Science"
        } ]
      } ],
      "publicationDate" : "Sat Dec 31 00:00:00 UTC 1988",
      "keywords" : [ "Animals<br />Chick Embryo<br />Growth Hormone<br />Iodide Peroxidase<br />Liver<br />Thyroxine<br />Tissue Extracts<br />Triiodothyronine" ],
      "pmcid" : "2757759",
      "identifier" : "348584SE",
      "doi" : "10.1051/rnd:19890207",
      "pageStart" : "197",
      "pageEnd" : "202",
      "volume" : "29",
      "issue" : "2",
      "type" : [ "AcademicArticle" ],
      "modTime" : "Fri Mar 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",
      "_links" : {
        "self" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n348584SE"
        },
        "individual" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual{?page,size,sort}",
          "templated" : true
        },
        "export" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n348584SE/export?type=docx"
        }
      }
    } ]
  },
  "_links" : {
    "self" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/search/advanced?page=1&size=20&sort=id,asc"
    }
  },
  "facets" : [ {
    "field" : "type",
    "entries" : {
      "content" : [ {
        "value" : "academicarticle",
        "count" : 2,
        "valueKey" : "academicarticle"
      }, {
        "value" : "conferencepaper",
        "count" : 1,
        "valueKey" : "conferencepaper"
      } ],
      "page" : {
        "size" : 10,
        "totalElements" : 2,
        "totalPages" : 1,
        "number" : 1
      }
    }
  } ],
  "highlights" : [ ],
  "page" : {
    "size" : 20,
    "totalElements" : 3,
    "totalPages" : 1,
    "number" : 1
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/advanced?q=*%3A*&df=_text_&facets=type&type.limit=5&type.offset=0&type.sort=COUNT&filters=class&class.filter=Document&page=0&size=20&sort=id' -i -X GET

1.3.5. Export Search

This export will return a stream of specified type containing the search results with the requested fields, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+query+

The search query

+type+

The search export format type

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.

+export+

The search export fields
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/export?query=*&type=csv&filters=class&class.filter=Document&export=id%2CId&export=type%2CType&export=individual%2CIndividual HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Disposition: attachment; filename=export.csv
Content-Type: text/csv
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 221

Id,Type,Individual
n284161SE,ConferencePaper,http://localhost:4200/display/n284161SE
n313910SE,AcademicArticle,http://localhost:4200/display/n313910SE
n348584SE,AcademicArticle,http://localhost:4200/display/n348584SE
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/export?query=*&type=csv&filters=class&class.filter=Document&export=id%2CId&export=type%2CType&export=individual%2CIndividual' -i -X GET

1.3.6. Export Single Page

This export will return a stream of specified type containing the single page built from the associated export view. An export view must be added to the display view for the type of document.

Path Parameters
Table 6. /individual/{id}/export
Parameter Description

+id+

The individual id
Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+type+

The single page export format type
Sample Request
GET /individual/n284161SE/export?type=docx HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/n284161SE/export?type=docx' -i -X GET

1.3.7. Count

This count will return a json response containing the count, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+q+

The search query.

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+value+

+Number+

The resulting count.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/count?q=*%3A*&filters=class&class.filter=Document HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 17

{
  "value" : 3
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/count?q=*%3A*&filters=class&class.filter=Document' -i -X GET

1.3.8. Recently Updated

This will return a json response listing recently updated documents, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+limit+

The number of recently updated documents to return.

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+_embedded.individual+

+Array+

An array of Document resources.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/recentlyUpdated?limit=2&filters=class&class.filter=Document HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 3918

1.4. Organizations

1.4.1. Page

This provides a page of all the organizations present in the system, based on the request parameters as shown.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+page+

The page number.

+size+

The page size.

+sort+

The page sort [field,asc/desc].
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+_embedded.individual+

+Array+

An array of Organization resources.

+_links+

+Object+

Links to other resources.

+page+

+Object+

Page details for Organization resources.

+facets+

+Array+

Facets for Organization resources.

+highlights+

+Array+

Highlights for Organization resources.
Sample Request
GET /individual?page=0&size=10&sort=id HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 97325

    }, {
      "id" : "n284161SE",
      "class" : "Document",
      "title" : "Cascade industrial VSI gives medium voltage-a case study",
      "abstract" : "In this paper, the modularity concept applied to medium-voltage adjustable speed drives (MV-ASD) is addressed. First, the single-phase cascaded (SC) VSI that uses series connection of IGBT H-bridge modules with isolated DC-buses is presented. Next, a novel triphase cascaded (TC) VSI that uses three IGBT triphase inverter modules along with an output transformer to obtain a 3 p.u. multilevel output voltage is introduced. The system yields a high-quality multistep voltage with up to 4 levels and low dv/dt, balanced operation of the inverter modules that supply each a third of the motor kVA. The concept of using TC-VSI is further extended to a new modular motor-modular inverter (MM-MI) system where the MV motor winding connections are reconnected into several three-phase groups, either six-lead or twelve-lead connection according to the voltage height, each powered by a standard triphase IGBT inverter module. Thus a high fault-tolerance is being achieved and the output transformer requirement is eliminated. A staggered space vector modulation (SSVM) technique applicable to triphase cascaded VSI topologies is also demonstrated. Both TC-VSI and MM-MI computer simulations and experimental tests demonstrate the feasibility of the systems",
      "authors" : [ {
        "id" : "n66ebcf36",
        "label" : "Enjeti, Prasad",
        "organizations" : [ {
          "id" : "n2478ed4a",
          "label" : "Electrical and Computer Engineering"
        } ]
      } ],
      "publicationDate" : "Fri Dec 31 00:00:00 UTC 1999",

    }, {
      "id" : "n348584SE",
      "class" : "Document",
      "title" : "Evidence for chicken GH as the only hypophyseal factor responsible for the stimulation of hepatic 5'-monodeiodination activity in the chick embryo",
      "abstract" : "The influence of an intravenous injection of chicken growth hormone (cGH), a total chicken pars distalis (PD) extract, and a PD extract depleted of cGH by immunoadsorption was studied in the 18-d-old chick embryo. Plasma concentrations of triiodothyronine (T3), thyroxine (T4), and hepatic 5'-monodeiodination (5'-D) activity were measured. An injection of total PD extract raised plasma T3, T4, and 5'-D activity, whereas a PD extract depleted of GH only increased plasma T4. The amount of cGH present in the PD extracts, as measured by homologous cGH radioimmunoassay, increased T3 and raised liver 5'-D, but had no effect on plasma T4. The effect on liver 5'-D was more pronounced with cGH than with a total PD extract, whereas the effect on plasma T3 was somewhat less pronounced. It was concluded that cGH increased the peripheral conversion of T4 into T3 in the chick embryo, whereas a PD extract depleted of cGH was purely thyrotropic. The PD extract also seemed to have 5'-D-suppressing activity.",
      "publicationVenue" : {
        "id" : "n0181-1916ISSN",

}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual?page=0&size=10&sort=id' -i -X GET

1.4.2. Find by id

This will find an organization based on the individual id provided as a parameter as shown in Path Parameters. The json response will have the specific organization as shown in the Sample Response.

Path Parameters
Table 7. /individual/{id}
Parameter Description

+id+

The Organization id.
Sample Request
GET /individual/na7893461 HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 4199

1.4.3. Find by id In

This will find a list of organizations based on the individual ids provided as a parameter as shown in Request Parameters. The json response will have the list of organizations as shown in the Sample Response.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+ids+

The Organization ids.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/findByIdIn?ids=nbc8951b7%2Cn157a64e9%2Cna7893461 HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 10062

CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/findByIdIn?ids=nbc8951b7%2Cn157a64e9%2Cna7893461' -i -X GET

1.4.4. Search

This search will return a json response listing all the organizations, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+q+

The search query.

+df+

The default search field.

+facets+

The facet fields.

+type.limit+

Type facet limit.

+type.offset+

Type facet offset.

+type.sort+

Type facet sort {index/count}.

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.

+page+

The page number.

+size+

The page size.

+sort+

The page sort field,{asc/desc}.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+_embedded.individual+

+Array+

An array of Organization resources.

+_links+

+Object+

Links to other resources.

+page+

+Object+

Page details for Organization resources.

+facets+

+Array+

Facets for Organization resources.

+highlights+

+Array+

Highlights for Organization resources.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/advanced?q=*%3A*&df=_text_&facets=type&type.limit=5&type.offset=0&type.sort=COUNT&filters=class&class.filter=Organization&page=0&size=20&sort=id HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 11292

{
  "_embedded" : {
    "individual" : [ {
      "id" : "n157a64e9",
      "class" : "Organization",
      "name" : "Taylor & Francis",
      "type" : [ "Publisher" ],
      "modTime" : "Tue Jan 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",
      "_links" : {
        "self" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n157a64e9"

        "individual" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual{?page,size,sort}",

          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n157a64e9/export?type=docx"

    "field" : "type",
    "entries" : {
      "content" : [ {
        "value" : "academicdepartment",
        "count" : 1,
        "valueKey" : "academicdepartment"
      }, {
        "value" : "organization",
        "count" : 1,
        "valueKey" : "organization"
      }, {
        "value" : "publisher",
        "count" : 1,
        "valueKey" : "publisher"
      }, {
        "value" : "otheruniversity",
        "count" : 1,
        "valueKey" : "otheruniversity"
      } ],
      "page" : {
        "size" : 10,
        "totalElements" : 4,
        "totalPages" : 1,
        "number" : 1
      }
    }
  } ],
  "highlights" : [ ],
  "page" : {
    "size" : 20,
    "totalElements" : 3,
    "totalPages" : 1,
    "number" : 1
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/advanced?q=*%3A*&df=_text_&facets=type&type.limit=5&type.offset=0&type.sort=COUNT&filters=class&class.filter=Organization&page=0&size=20&sort=id' -i -X GET

1.4.5. Export Search

This export will return a stream of specified type containing the search results with the requested fields, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+query+

The search query

+type+

The search export format type

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.

+export+

The search export fields
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/export?query=*&type=csv&filters=class&class.filter=Organization&export=id%2CId&export=type%2CType&export=individual%2CIndividual HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Disposition: attachment; filename=export.csv
Content-Type: text/csv
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 232

Id,Type,Individual
n157a64e9,Publisher,http://localhost:4200/display/n157a64e9
na7893461,Organization||AcademicDepartment,http://localhost:4200/display/na7893461
nbc8951b7,otherUniversity,http://localhost:4200/display/nbc8951b7
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/export?query=*&type=csv&filters=class&class.filter=Organization&export=id%2CId&export=type%2CType&export=individual%2CIndividual' -i -X GET

1.4.6. Export Single Page

This export will return a stream of specified type containing the single page built from the associated export view. An export view must be added to the display view for the type of organization.

Path Parameters
Table 8. /individual/{id}/export
Parameter Description

+id+

The individual id
Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+type+

The single page export format type
Sample Request
GET /individual/nbc8951b7/export?type=docx HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/nbc8951b7/export?type=docx' -i -X GET

1.4.7. Count

This count will return a json response containing the count, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+q+

The search query.

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+value+

+Number+

The resulting count.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/count?q=*%3A*&filters=class&class.filter=Organization HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 17

{
  "value" : 3
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/count?q=*%3A*&filters=class&class.filter=Organization' -i -X GET

1.4.8. Recently Updated

This will return a json response listing recently updated organizations, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+limit+

The number of recently updated documents to return.

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+_embedded.individual+

+Array+

An array of Organization resources.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/recentlyUpdated?limit=2&filters=class&class.filter=Organization HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 9849

1.5. Persons

1.5.1. Page

This provides a page of all the persons present in the system, based on the request parameters as shown.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+page+

The page number.

+size+

The page size.

+sort+

The page sort [field,asc/desc].
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+_embedded.individual+

+Array+

An array of Person resources.

+_links+

+Object+

Links to other resources.

+page+

+Object+

Page details for Person resources.

+facets+

+Array+

Facets for Person resources.

+highlights+

+Array+

Highlights for Person resources.
Sample Request
GET /individual?page=0&size=10&sort=id HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 97325

      "overview" : "My research focuses on: (a) Development of improved materials for various applications: electrical conductors including superconductors, light weight structures, high density structures, and human implants (Mg and Ti); (b) Understanding structure-property-processing relationships in metal alloys; (c) Severe plastic deformation processing of solid and particulate materials via equal channel angular extrusion (ECAE); (d) Applied superconductivity - superconductor stabilizer materials and conductor design; and (e) Material failure analysis.",

    }, {
      "id" : "n284161SE",
      "class" : "Document",
      "title" : "Cascade industrial VSI gives medium voltage-a case study",
      "abstract" : "In this paper, the modularity concept applied to medium-voltage adjustable speed drives (MV-ASD) is addressed. First, the single-phase cascaded (SC) VSI that uses series connection of IGBT H-bridge modules with isolated DC-buses is presented. Next, a novel triphase cascaded (TC) VSI that uses three IGBT triphase inverter modules along with an output transformer to obtain a 3 p.u. multilevel output voltage is introduced. The system yields a high-quality multistep voltage with up to 4 levels and low dv/dt, balanced operation of the inverter modules that supply each a third of the motor kVA. The concept of using TC-VSI is further extended to a new modular motor-modular inverter (MM-MI) system where the MV motor winding connections are reconnected into several three-phase groups, either six-lead or twelve-lead connection according to the voltage height, each powered by a standard triphase IGBT inverter module. Thus a high fault-tolerance is being achieved and the output transformer requirement is eliminated. A staggered space vector modulation (SSVM) technique applicable to triphase cascaded VSI topologies is also demonstrated. Both TC-VSI and MM-MI computer simulations and experimental tests demonstrate the feasibility of the systems",
      "authors" : [ {
        "id" : "n66ebcf36",
        "label" : "Enjeti, Prasad",
        "organizations" : [ {
          "id" : "n2478ed4a",
          "label" : "Electrical and Computer Engineering"
        } ]
      } ],
      "publicationDate" : "Fri Dec 31 00:00:00 UTC 1999",
      "keywords" : [ "Invertors<br />Igbt H-bridge Modules<br />Igbt Triphase Inverter Modules<br />Mv Motor Winding Connections<br />Cascade Industrial Vsi<br />Computer Simulation<br />Experimental Tests<br />Fault-tolerance<br />High-quality Multistep Voltage<br />Isolated Dc-buses<br />Medium-voltage Adjustable Speed Drives<br />Output Transformer<br />Series Connection<br />Staggered Space Vector Modulation" ],

    }, {
      "id" : "n348584SE",
      "class" : "Document",
      "title" : "Evidence for chicken GH as the only hypophyseal factor responsible for the stimulation of hepatic 5'-monodeiodination activity in the chick embryo",
      "abstract" : "The influence of an intravenous injection of chicken growth hormone (cGH), a total chicken pars distalis (PD) extract, and a PD extract depleted of cGH by immunoadsorption was studied in the 18-d-old chick embryo. Plasma concentrations of triiodothyronine (T3), thyroxine (T4), and hepatic 5'-monodeiodination (5'-D) activity were measured. An injection of total PD extract raised plasma T3, T4, and 5'-D activity, whereas a PD extract depleted of GH only increased plasma T4. The amount of cGH present in the PD extracts, as measured by homologous cGH radioimmunoassay, increased T3 and raised liver 5'-D, but had no effect on plasma T4. The effect on liver 5'-D was more pronounced with cGH than with a total PD extract, whereas the effect on plasma T3 was somewhat less pronounced. It was concluded that cGH increased the peripheral conversion of T4 into T3 in the chick embryo, whereas a PD extract depleted of cGH was purely thyrotropic. The PD extract also seemed to have 5'-D-suppressing activity.",
      "publicationVenue" : {
        "id" : "n0181-1916ISSN",
        "label" : "Reproduction Nutrition Development"
      },
      "authors" : [ {
        "id" : "n3e016f20",
        "label" : "Berghman, Luc",
        "organizations" : [ {
          "id" : "n3af9f727",
          "label" : "Veterinary Pathobiology"
        }, {
          "id" : "nf479a540",
          "label" : "Poultry Science"
        } ]
      } ],
      "publicationDate" : "Sat Dec 31 00:00:00 UTC 1988",
      "keywords" : [ "Animals<br />Chick Embryo<br />Growth Hormone<br />Iodide Peroxidase<br />Liver<br />Thyroxine<br />Tissue Extracts<br />Triiodothyronine" ],
      "pmcid" : "2757759",

      "overview" : "Research areas focus on acquiring fundamental new knowledge of the avian immune system and applying this new knowledge toward the development  of new immuno-biotechnological tools.  Research projects include the study of the immune response in the chicken, especially the function of antigen presenting cells (such as the dendritic cells) in activating the humeral immune response and the development of chicken egg yolk antibodies, monoclonal antibodies and recombinant antibodies for diagnostic, prophylactic and therapeutic purposes. Dr. Berghman was the recipient of the 2016 Zoetis Fundamental Science Award.",

    "self" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual"

    "next" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual?page=2&size=10&sort=id,asc"
    },
    "last" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual?page=3&size=10&sort=id,asc"
    },
    "profile" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/profile/individual"
    },
    "search" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/search"
    }
  },
  "facets" : [ ],
  "highlights" : [ ],
  "page" : {
    "size" : 10,
    "totalElements" : 21,
    "totalPages" : 3,
    "number" : 1
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual?page=0&size=10&sort=id' -i -X GET

1.5.2. Find by id

This will find an person based on the individual id provided as a parameter as shown in Path Parameters. The json response will have the specific person as shown in the Sample Response.

Path Parameters
Table 9. /individual/{id}
Parameter Description

+id+

The Person id.
Sample Request
GET /individual/n163f68fe HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 36805

CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/n163f68fe' -i -X GET

1.5.3. Find by id In

This will find a list of persons based on the individual ids provided as a parameter as shown in Request Parameters. The json response will have the list of persons as shown in the Sample Response.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+ids+

The Person ids.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/findByIdIn?ids=n5889f585%2Cn3e016f20%2Cn163f68fe HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 102624

    "individual" : [ {
      "id" : "n5889f585",
      "class" : "Person",
      "name" : "Vemulapalli, Ramesh",

        "id" : "nc544aee7",

          "id" : "n3af9f727",
          "label" : "Veterinary Pathobiology",
          "parent" : [ {
            "id" : "n1978f11a",
            "label" : "College of Veterinary Medicine and Biomedical Sciences"
          } ]
        } ]
      } ],
      "overview" : "Dr. Vemulapalli's research is primarily focused on the development of recombinant vaccines against infectious diseases.  One of the targets of his vaccine research is  brucellosis, a bacterial zoonotic disease caused by certain members of the genus Brucella.  Brucellosis is a great concern to public health in developing countries due to widespread prevalence of Brucella infections in livestock.  In the US, reservoirs of Brucella infections in wildlife, such as bison, elk, and feral swine, continue to pose a threat to livestock industries and human health.  The currently available brucellosis veterinary vaccines are neither efficacious in wild animals nor safe for human use.  Dr. Vemulapalli has developed novel recombinant vaccine strains that showed dramatically enhanced vaccine efficacy against brucellosis in murine models.  Testing these vaccines in domestic and wild animals is a goal of his research program.  Research projects in his laboratory are aimed at 1) understanding the pathogenic mechanisms of Brucella species, 2) developing attenuated Brucella strains as vectors to deliver protective proteins of other pathogens and tumors, 3) developing recombinant subunit vaccines to porcine reproductive and respiratory syndrome virus, and 4) development of molecular diagnostics assays for infectious disease investigations.",

      "overview" : "Research areas focus on acquiring fundamental new knowledge of the avian immune system and applying this new knowledge toward the development  of new immuno-biotechnological tools.  Research projects include the study of the immune response in the chicken, especially the function of antigen presenting cells (such as the dendritic cells) in activating the humeral immune response and the development of chicken egg yolk antibodies, monoclonal antibodies and recombinant antibodies for diagnostic, prophylactic and therapeutic purposes. CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/findByIdIn?ids=n5889f585%2Cn3e016f20%2Cn163f68fe' -i -X GET

1.5.4. Search

This search will return a json response listing all the persons, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+q+

The search query.

+df+

The default search field.

+facets+

The facet fields.

+type.limit+

Type facet limit.

+type.offset+

Type facet offset.

+type.sort+

Type facet sort {index/count}.

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.

+page+

The page number.

+size+

The page size.

+sort+

The page sort field,{asc/desc}.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+_embedded.individual+

+Array+

An array of Person resources.

+_links+

+Object+

Links to other resources.

+page+

+Object+

Page details for Person resources.

+facets+

+Array+

Facets for Person resources.

+highlights+

+Array+

Highlights for Person resources.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/advanced?q=*%3A*&df=_text_&facets=type&type.limit=5&type.offset=0&type.sort=COUNT&filters=class&class.filter=Person&page=0&size=20&sort=id HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 103538

      "overview" : "Research areas focus on acquiring fundamental new knowledge of the avian immune system and applying this new knowledge toward the development  of new immuno-biotechnological tools.  Research projects include the study of the immune response in the chicken, especially the function of antigen presenting cells (such as the dendritic cells) in activating the humeral immune response and the development of chicken egg yolk antibodies, monoclonal antibodies and recombinant antibodies for diagnostic, prophylactic and therapeutic purposes.             "id" : "n1978f11a",
            "label" : "College of Veterinary Medicine and Biomedical Sciences"
