      } ],
      "overview" : "Dr. Vemulapalli's research is primarily focused on the development of recombinant vaccines against infectious diseases.  One of the targets of his vaccine research is  brucellosis, a bacterial zoonotic disease caused by certain members of the genus Brucella.  Brucellosis is a great concern to public health in developing countries due to widespread prevalence of Brucella infections in livestock.  In the US, reservoirs of Brucella infections in wildlife, such as bison, elk, and feral swine, continue to pose a threat to livestock industries and human health.  The currently available brucellosis veterinary vaccines are neither efficacious in wild animals nor safe for human use.  Dr. Vemulapalli has developed novel recombinant vaccine strains that showed dramatically enhanced vaccine efficacy against brucellosis in murine models.  Testing these vaccines in domestic and wild animals is a goal of his research program.  Research projects in his laboratory are aimed at 1) understanding the pathogenic mechanisms of Brucella species, 2) developing attenuated Brucella strains as vectors to deliver protective proteins of other pathogens and tumors, 3) developing recombinant subunit vaccines to porcine reproductive and respiratory syndrome virus, and 4) development of molecular diagnostics assays for infectious disease investigations.",

    "self" : {

    }
  },
  "facets" : [ {
    "field" : "type",
    "entries" : {
      "content" : [ {
        "value" : "facultymember",

CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/advanced?q=*%3A*&df=_text_&facets=type&type.limit=5&type.offset=0&type.sort=COUNT&filters=class&class.filter=Person&page=0&size=20&sort=id' -i -X GET

1.5.5. Export Search

This export will return a stream of specified type containing the search results with the requested fields, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+query+

The search query

+type+

The search export format type

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.

+export+

The search export fields
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/export?query=*&type=csv&filters=class&class.filter=Person&export=id%2CId&export=type%2CType&export=individual%2CIndividual HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Disposition: attachment; filename=export.csv
Content-Type: text/csv
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 215

Id,Type,Individual
n163f68fe,FacultyMember,http://localhost:4200/display/n163f68fe
n3e016f20,FacultyMember,http://localhost:4200/display/n3e016f20
n5889f585,FacultyMember,http://localhost:4200/display/n5889f585
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/export?query=*&type=csv&filters=class&class.filter=Person&export=id%2CId&export=type%2CType&export=individual%2CIndividual' -i -X GET

1.5.6. Export Single Page

This export will return a stream of specified type containing the single page built from the associated export view. An export view must be added to the display view for the type of person.

Path Parameters
Table 10. /individual/{id}/export
Parameter Description

+id+

The individual id
Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+type+

The single page export format type
Sample Request
GET /individual/n5889f585/export?type=docx HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/n5889f585/export?type=docx' -i -X GET

1.5.7. Count

This count will return a json response containing the count, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+q+

The search query.

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+value+

+Number+

The resulting count.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/count?q=*%3A*&filters=class&class.filter=Person HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 17

{
  "value" : 3
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/count?q=*%3A*&filters=class&class.filter=Person' -i -X GET

1.5.8. Recently Updated

This will return a json response listing recently updated persons, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+limit+

The number of recently updated documents to return.

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+_embedded.individual+

+Array+

An array of Person resources.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/recentlyUpdated?limit=2&filters=class&class.filter=Person HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 80904

      "overview" : "Research areas focus on acquiring fundamental new knowledge of the avian immune system and applying this new knowledge toward the development  of new immuno-biotechnological tools.  Research projects include the study of the immune response in the chicken, especially the function of antigen presenting cells (such as the dendritic cells) in activating the humeral immune response and the development of chicken egg yolk antibodies, monoclonal antibodies and recombinant antibodies for diagnostic, prophylactic and therapeutic purposes. }
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/recentlyUpdated?limit=2&filters=class&class.filter=Person' -i -X GET

1.6. Processes

1.6.1. Page

This provides a page of all the processes present in the system, based on the request parameters as shown.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+page+

The page number.

+size+

The page size.

+sort+

The page sort [field,asc/desc].
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+_embedded.individual+

+Array+

An array of Process resources.

+_links+

+Object+

Links to other resources.

+page+

+Object+

Page details for Process resources.

+facets+

+Array+

Facets for Process resources.

+highlights+

+Array+

Highlights for Process resources.
Sample Request
GET /individual?page=0&size=10&sort=id HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 97325

    }, {
      "id" : "n284161SE",
      "class" : "Document",
      "title" : "Cascade industrial VSI gives medium voltage-a case study",
      "abstract" : "In this paper, the modularity concept applied to medium-voltage adjustable speed drives (MV-ASD) is addressed. First, the single-phase cascaded (SC) VSI that uses series connection of IGBT H-bridge modules with isolated DC-buses is presented. Next, a novel triphase cascaded (TC) VSI that uses three IGBT triphase inverter modules along with an output transformer to obtain a 3 p.u. multilevel output voltage is introduced. The system yields a high-quality multistep voltage with up to 4 levels and low dv/dt, balanced operation of the inverter modules that supply each a third of the motor kVA. The concept of using TC-VSI is further extended to a new modular motor-modular inverter (MM-MI) system where the MV motor winding connections are reconnected into several three-phase groups, either six-lead or twelve-lead connection according to the voltage height, each powered by a standard triphase IGBT inverter module. Thus a high fault-tolerance is being achieved and the output transformer requirement is eliminated. A staggered space vector modulation (SSVM) technique applicable to triphase cascaded VSI topologies is also demonstrated. Both TC-VSI and MM-MI computer simulations and experimental tests demonstrate the feasibility of the systems",
      "authors" : [ {
        "id" : "n66ebcf36",
        "label" : "Enjeti, Prasad",
        "organizations" : [ {
          "id" : "n2478ed4a",
          "label" : "Electrical and Computer Engineering"
        } ]
      } ],
      "publicationDate" : "Fri Dec 31 00:00:00 UTC 1999",

    }, {
      "id" : "n348584SE",
      "class" : "Document",
      "title" : "Evidence for chicken GH as the only hypophyseal factor responsible for the stimulation of hepatic 5'-monodeiodination activity in the chick embryo",
      "abstract" : "The influence of an intravenous injection of chicken growth hormone (cGH), a total chicken pars distalis (PD) extract, and a PD extract depleted of cGH by immunoadsorption was studied in the 18-d-old chick embryo. Plasma concentrations of triiodothyronine (T3), thyroxine (T4), and hepatic 5'-monodeiodination (5'-D) activity were measured. An injection of total PD extract raised plasma T3, T4, and 5'-D activity, whereas a PD extract depleted of GH only increased plasma T4. The amount of cGH present in the PD extracts, as measured by homologous cGH radioimmunoassay, increased T3 and raised liver 5'-D, but had no effect on plasma T4. The effect on liver 5'-D was more pronounced with cGH than with a total PD extract, whereas the effect on plasma T3 was somewhat less pronounced. It was concluded that cGH increased the peripheral conversion of T4 into T3 in the chick embryo, whereas a PD extract depleted of cGH was purely thyrotropic. The PD extract also seemed to have 5'-D-suppressing activity.",
      "publicationVenue" : {
        "id" : "n0181-1916ISSN",

    "totalPages" : 3,
    "number" : 1
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual?page=0&size=10&sort=id' -i -X GET

1.6.2. Find by id

This will find an process based on the individual id provided as a parameter as shown in Path Parameters. The json response will have the specific process as shown in the Sample Response.

Path Parameters
Table 11. /individual/{id}
Parameter Description

+id+

The Process id.
Sample Request
GET /individual/ndcac0c82_bc8951b7_730827c3 HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 840

{
  "id" : "ndcac0c82_bc8951b7_730827c3",
  "class" : "Process",
  "dateTimeIntervalEnd" : "Tue Dec 31 00:00:00 UTC 1991",
  "outputPublicationOrOtherWork" : [ {
    "id" : "ndcac0c82_730827c3",
    "label" : "Ahmed, Anwer: Ph.D. Doctor of Philosophy"
  } ],
  "hasOutput" : [ {
    "id" : "ndcac0c82_730827c3",
    "label" : "Ahmed, Anwer: Ph.D. Doctor of Philosophy"
  } ],
  "hasParticipant" : [ {
    "id" : "ndcac0c82",
    "label" : "Ahmed, Anwer"
  }, {
    "id" : "nbc8951b7",
    "label" : "University of Rochester"
  } ],
  "type" : [ "EducationalProcess" ],
  "modTime" : "Fri Feb 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",
  "_links" : {
    "self" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/ndcac0c82_bc8951b7_730827c3"
    },
    "individual" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/ndcac0c82_bc8951b7_730827c3"
    }
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/ndcac0c82_bc8951b7_730827c3' -i -X GET

1.6.3. Find by id In

This will find a list of processes based on the individual ids provided as a parameter as shown in Request Parameters. The json response will have the list of processes as shown in the Sample Response.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+ids+

The Process ids.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/findByIdIn?ids=n790f6f11%2Cneab33b90%2Cndcac0c82_bc8951b7_730827c3 HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 2146

{
  "_embedded" : {
    "individual" : [ {
      "id" : "n790f6f11",
      "class" : "Process",
      "title" : "MSEN444 Corrosion And Electrochem Lab",
      "participants" : [ {
        "id" : "n4d1ebe08",
        "label" : "Castaneda, Homero"
      } ],
      "type" : [ "Course" ],
      "modTime" : "Tue Jan 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",
      "_links" : {
        "self" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n790f6f11"
        },
        "individual" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n790f6f11"
        }
      }
    }, {
      "id" : "neab33b90",
      "class" : "Process",
      "title" : "NURS554 Clin Prevent & Pop Hlth",
      "participants" : [ {
        "id" : "n5ee635f4",
        "label" : "Page, Robin"
      } ],
      "type" : [ "Course" ],
      "modTime" : "Fri Mar 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",
      "_links" : {
        "self" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/neab33b90"
        },
        "individual" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/neab33b90"
        }
      }
    }, {
      "id" : "ndcac0c82_bc8951b7_730827c3",
      "class" : "Process",
      "dateTimeIntervalEnd" : "Tue Dec 31 00:00:00 UTC 1991",

        "id" : "ndcac0c82_730827c3",

      "_links" : {
        "self" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/ndcac0c82_bc8951b7_730827c3"
        },
        "individual" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/ndcac0c82_bc8951b7_730827c3"
        }
      }
    } ]
  },
  "_links" : {
    "self" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/search/findByIdIn"
    }
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/findByIdIn?ids=n790f6f11%2Cneab33b90%2Cndcac0c82_bc8951b7_730827c3' -i -X GET

1.6.4. Search

This search will return a json response listing all the processes, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+q+

The search query.

+df+

The default search field.

+facets+

The facet fields.

+type.limit+

Type facet limit.

+type.offset+

Type facet offset.

+type.sort+

Type facet sort {index/count}.

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.

+page+

The page number.

+size+

The page size.

+sort+

The page sort field,{asc/desc}.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+_embedded.individual+

+Array+

An array of Process resources.

+_links+

+Object+

Links to other resources.

+page+

+Object+

Page details for Process resources.

+facets+

+Array+

Facets for Process resources.

+highlights+

+Array+

Highlights for Process resources.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/advanced?q=*%3A*&df=_text_&facets=type&type.limit=5&type.offset=0&type.sort=COUNT&filters=class&class.filter=Process&page=0&size=20&sort=id HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 3160

{
  "_embedded" : {
    "individual" : [ {
      "id" : "n790f6f11",
      "class" : "Process",
      "title" : "MSEN444 Corrosion And Electrochem Lab",
      "participants" : [ {
        "id" : "n4d1ebe08",
        "label" : "Castaneda, Homero"
      } ],
      "type" : [ "Course" ],
      "modTime" : "Tue Jan 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",
      "_links" : {
        "self" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n790f6f11"
        },
        "individual" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual{?page,size,sort}",
          "templated" : true
        },
        "export" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n790f6f11/export?type=docx"
        }
      }
    }, {
      "id" : "ndcac0c82_bc8951b7_730827c3",
      "class" : "Process",
      "dateTimeIntervalEnd" : "Tue Dec 31 00:00:00 UTC 1991",
      "outputPublicationOrOtherWork" : [ {
        "id" : "ndcac0c82_730827c3",
        "label" : "Ahmed, Anwer: Ph.D. Doctor of Philosophy"
      } ],
      "hasOutput" : [ {
        "id" : "ndcac0c82_730827c3",
        "label" : "Ahmed, Anwer: Ph.D. Doctor of Philosophy"
      } ],
      "hasParticipant" : [ {
        "id" : "ndcac0c82",
        "label" : "Ahmed, Anwer"
      }, {
        "id" : "nbc8951b7",
        "label" : "University of Rochester"
      } ],
      "type" : [ "EducationalProcess" ],
      "modTime" : "Fri Feb 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",
      "_links" : {
        "self" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/ndcac0c82_bc8951b7_730827c3"
        },
        "individual" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual{?page,size,sort}",
          "templated" : true
        },
        "export" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/ndcac0c82_bc8951b7_730827c3/export?type=docx"
        }
      }
    }, {
      "id" : "neab33b90",
      "class" : "Process",
      "title" : "NURS554 Clin Prevent & Pop Hlth",
      "participants" : [ {
        "id" : "n5ee635f4",
        "label" : "Page, Robin"
      } ],
      "type" : [ "Course" ],
      "modTime" : "Fri Mar 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",
      "_links" : {
        "self" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/neab33b90"
        },
        "individual" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual{?page,size,sort}",
          "templated" : true
        },
        "export" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/neab33b90/export?type=docx"
        }
      }
    } ]
  },
  "_links" : {
    "self" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/search/advanced?page=1&size=20&sort=id,asc"
    }
  },
  "facets" : [ {
    "field" : "type",
    "entries" : {
      "content" : [ {
        "value" : "course",
        "count" : 2,
        "valueKey" : "course"
      }, {
        "value" : "educationalprocess",
        "count" : 1,
        "valueKey" : "educationalprocess"
      } ],
      "page" : {
        "size" : 10,
        "totalElements" : 2,
        "totalPages" : 1,
        "number" : 1
      }
    }
  } ],
  "highlights" : [ ],
  "page" : {
    "size" : 20,
    "totalElements" : 3,
    "totalPages" : 1,
    "number" : 1
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/advanced?q=*%3A*&df=_text_&facets=type&type.limit=5&type.offset=0&type.sort=COUNT&filters=class&class.filter=Process&page=0&size=20&sort=id' -i -X GET

1.6.5. Export Search

This export will return a stream of specified type containing the search results with the requested fields, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+query+

The search query

+type+

The search export format type

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.

+export+

The search export fields
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/export?query=*&type=csv&filters=class&class.filter=Process&export=id%2CId&export=type%2CType&export=individual%2CIndividual HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Disposition: attachment; filename=export.csv
Content-Type: text/csv
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 242

Id,Type,Individual
n790f6f11,Course,http://localhost:4200/display/n790f6f11
ndcac0c82_bc8951b7_730827c3,EducationalProcess,http://localhost:4200/display/ndcac0c82_bc8951b7_730827c3
neab33b90,Course,http://localhost:4200/display/neab33b90
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/export?query=*&type=csv&filters=class&class.filter=Process&export=id%2CId&export=type%2CType&export=individual%2CIndividual' -i -X GET

1.6.6. Export Single Page

This export will return a stream of specified type containing the single page built from the associated export view. An export view must be added to the display view for the type of process.

Path Parameters
Table 12. /individual/{id}/export
Parameter Description

+id+

The individual id
Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+type+

The single page export format type
Sample Request
GET /individual/n790f6f11/export?type=docx HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/n790f6f11/export?type=docx' -i -X GET

1.6.7. Count

This count will return a json response containing the count, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+q+

The search query.

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+value+

+Number+

The resulting count.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/count?q=*%3A*&filters=class&class.filter=Process HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 17

{
  "value" : 3
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/count?q=*%3A*&filters=class&class.filter=Process' -i -X GET

1.6.8. Recently Updated

This will return a json response listing recently updated processes, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+limit+

The number of recently updated documents to return.

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+_embedded.individual+

+Array+

An array of Process resources.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/recentlyUpdated?limit=2&filters=class&class.filter=Process HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 1815

{
  "_embedded" : {
    "individual" : [ {
      "id" : "neab33b90",
      "class" : "Process",
      "title" : "NURS554 Clin Prevent & Pop Hlth",

        "id" : "n5ee635f4",
        "label" : "Page, Robin"
      } ],

      }

}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/recentlyUpdated?limit=2&filters=class&class.filter=Process' -i -X GET

1.7. Relationships

1.7.1. Page

This provides a page of all the relationships present in the system, based on the request parameters as shown.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+page+

The page number.

+size+

The page size.

+sort+

The page sort [field,asc/desc].
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+_embedded.individual+

+Array+

An array of Relationship resources.

+_links+

+Object+

Links to other resources.

+page+

+Object+

Page details for Relationship resources.

+facets+

+Array+

Facets for Relationship resources.

+highlights+

+Array+

Highlights for Relationship resources.
Sample Request
GET /individual?page=0&size=10&sort=id HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 97325

    }, {
      "id" : "n284161SE",
      "class" : "Document",
      "title" : "Cascade industrial VSI gives medium voltage-a case study",
      "abstract" : "In this paper, the modularity concept applied to medium-voltage adjustable speed drives (MV-ASD) is addressed. First, the single-phase cascaded (SC) VSI that uses series connection of IGBT H-bridge modules with isolated DC-buses is presented. Next, a novel triphase cascaded (TC) VSI that uses three IGBT triphase inverter modules along with an output transformer to obtain a 3 p.u. multilevel output voltage is introduced. The system yields a high-quality multistep voltage with up to 4 levels and low dv/dt, balanced operation of the inverter modules that supply each a third of the motor kVA. The concept of using TC-VSI is further extended to a new modular motor-modular inverter (MM-MI) system where the MV motor winding connections are reconnected into several three-phase groups, either six-lead or twelve-lead connection according to the voltage height, each powered by a standard triphase IGBT inverter module. Thus a high fault-tolerance is being achieved and the output transformer requirement is eliminated. A staggered space vector modulation (SSVM) technique applicable to triphase cascaded VSI topologies is also demonstrated. Both TC-VSI and MM-MI computer simulations and experimental tests demonstrate the feasibility of the systems",
      "authors" : [ {
        "id" : "n66ebcf36",
        "label" : "Enjeti, Prasad",
        "organizations" : [ {
          "id" : "n2478ed4a",
          "label" : "Electrical and Computer Engineering"
        } ]
      } ],
      "publicationDate" : "Fri Dec 31 00:00:00 UTC 1999",
      "keywords" : [ "Invertors<br />Igbt H-bridge Modules<br />Igbt Triphase Inverter Modules<br />Mv Motor Winding Connections<br />Cascade Industrial Vsi<br />Computer Simulation<br />Experimental Tests<br />Fault-tolerance<br />High-quality Multistep Voltage<br />Isolated Dc-buses<br />Medium-voltage Adjustable Speed Drives<br />Output Transformer<br />Series Connection<br />Staggered Space Vector Modulation" ],

    }, {
      "id" : "n348584SE",
      "class" : "Document",
      "title" : "Evidence for chicken GH as the only hypophyseal factor responsible for the stimulation of hepatic 5'-monodeiodination activity in the chick embryo",
      "abstract" : "The influence of an intravenous injection of chicken growth hormone (cGH), a total chicken pars distalis (PD) extract, and a PD extract depleted of cGH by immunoadsorption was studied in the 18-d-old chick embryo. Plasma concentrations of triiodothyronine (T3), thyroxine (T4), and hepatic 5'-monodeiodination (5'-D) activity were measured. An injection of total PD extract raised plasma T3, T4, and 5'-D activity, whereas a PD extract depleted of GH only increased plasma T4. The amount of cGH present in the PD extracts, as measured by homologous cGH radioimmunoassay, increased T3 and raised liver 5'-D, but had no effect on plasma T4. The effect on liver 5'-D was more pronounced with cGH than with a total PD extract, whereas the effect on plasma T3 was somewhat less pronounced. It was concluded that cGH increased the peripheral conversion of T4 into T3 in the chick embryo, whereas a PD extract depleted of cGH was purely thyrotropic. The PD extract also seemed to have 5'-D-suppressing activity.",

      "postalCode" : "77843-2472",
      "country" : "USA",
      "type" : [ "FacultyMember" ],
      "modTime" : "Fri Feb 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",
      "_links" : {
        "self" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n3e016f20"
        },
        "individual" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n3e016f20"
        }
      }
    } ]
  },
  "_links" : {
    "first" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual?page=1&size=10&sort=id,asc"
    },
    "self" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual"
    },
    "next" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual?page=2&size=10&sort=id,asc"
    },
    "last" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual?page=3&size=10&sort=id,asc"
    },
    "profile" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/profile/individual"
    },
    "search" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/search"
    }
  },
  "facets" : [ ],
  "highlights" : [ ],
  "page" : {
    "size" : 10,
    "totalElements" : 21,
    "totalPages" : 3,
    "number" : 1
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual?page=0&size=10&sort=id' -i -X GET

1.7.2. Find by id

This will find an relationship based on the individual id provided as a parameter as shown in Path Parameters. The json response will have the specific relationship as shown in the Sample Response.

Path Parameters
Table 13. /individual/{id}
Parameter Description

+id+

The Relationship id.
Sample Request
GET /individual/na971ae5b HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 869

{
  "id" : "na971ae5b",
  "class" : "Relationship",
  "title" : "The Early Reading Intervention: Examination of Curriculum Efficacy, Durability, and Intensity",
  "awardedBy" : [ {
    "id" : "ngrid.419881.d",
    "label" : "United States Department of Education",
    "type" : "Organization"
  } ],
  "contributors" : [ {
    "id" : "nb2c12cd3",
    "label" : "Hagan-Burke, Shanna"
  } ],
  "coPrincipalInvestigators" : [ {
    "id" : "nb2c12cd3",
    "label" : "Hagan-Burke, Shanna"
  } ],
  "dateTimeIntervalStart" : "Sun Jan 01 00:00:00 UTC 2006",
  "dateTimeIntervalEnd" : "Sat Jan 01 00:00:00 UTC 2011",
  "type" : [ "Grant" ],
  "modTime" : "Fri Feb 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",
  "_links" : {
    "self" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/na971ae5b"
    },
    "individual" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/na971ae5b"
    }
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/na971ae5b' -i -X GET

1.7.3. Find by id In

This will find a list of relationships based on the individual ids provided as a parameter as shown in Request Parameters. The json response will have the list of relationships as shown in the Sample Response.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+ids+

The Relationship ids.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/findByIdIn?ids=n13af146b%2Cnf32a4434%2Cna971ae5b HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 2815

{
  "_embedded" : {
    "individual" : [ {
      "id" : "n13af146b",
      "class" : "Relationship",
      "title" : "Liquid-Fuel Combustion at Engine Conditions Using Laminar Flames and an Aerosol Shock Tube in Qatar",
      "awardedBy" : [ {
        "id" : "ngrid.418818.c",
        "label" : "Qatar Foundation",
        "type" : "Organization"
      } ],
      "contributors" : [ {
        "id" : "n08c7f257",
        "label" : "Guo, Bing"
      } ],
      "coPrincipalInvestigators" : [ {
        "id" : "n08c7f257",
        "label" : "Guo, Bing"
      } ],
      "type" : [ "Grant" ],
      "modTime" : "Fri Mar 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",
      "_links" : {
        "self" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n13af146b"
        },
        "individual" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n13af146b"
        }
      }
    }, {
      "id" : "nf32a4434",
      "class" : "Relationship",
      "title" : "Metadata design award (test) (Lee, Dong Joon)",
      "receiptOf" : [ {
        "id" : "nc7b1101c",
        "label" : "Metadata design award (test)"
      } ],
      "awardConferredBy" : [ {
        "id" : "n545e2322",
        "label" : "Accounting",
        "type" : "Organization"
      }, {
        "id" : "na420643f",
        "label" : "ABB (Finland)",
        "type" : "otherUniversity"
      } ],
      "yearAwarded" : "Fri Jan 01 00:00:00 UTC 2010",
      "type" : [ "AwardReceipt" ],
      "modTime" : "Tue Jan 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",

          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/nf32a4434"

          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/nf32a4434"
        }
      }
    }, {
      "id" : "na971ae5b",
      "class" : "Relationship",
      "title" : "The Early Reading Intervention: Examination of Curriculum Efficacy, Durability, and Intensity",

        "type" : "Organization"

        "id" : "nb2c12cd3",
        "label" : "Hagan-Burke, Shanna"

        "self" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/na971ae5b"
        },
        "individual" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/na971ae5b"
        }
      }
    } ]
  },
  "_links" : {
    "self" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/search/findByIdIn"
    }
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/findByIdIn?ids=n13af146b%2Cnf32a4434%2Cna971ae5b' -i -X GET

1.7.4. Search

This search will return a json response listing all the relationships, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+q+

The search query.

+df+

The default search field.

+facets+

The facet fields.

+type.limit+

Type facet limit.

+type.offset+

Type facet offset.

+type.sort+

Type facet sort {index/count}.

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.

+page+

The page number.

+size+

The page size.

+sort+

The page sort field,{asc/desc}.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+_embedded.individual+

+Array+

An array of Relationship resources.

+_links+

+Object+

Links to other resources.

+page+

+Object+

Page details for Relationship resources.

+facets+

+Array+

Facets for Relationship resources.

+highlights+

+Array+

Highlights for Relationship resources.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/advanced?q=*%3A*&df=_text_&facets=type&type.limit=5&type.offset=0&type.sort=COUNT&filters=class&class.filter=Relationship&page=0&size=20&sort=id HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 3815

{
  "_embedded" : {
    "individual" : [ {
      "id" : "n13af146b",
      "class" : "Relationship",
      "title" : "Liquid-Fuel Combustion at Engine Conditions Using Laminar Flames and an Aerosol Shock Tube in Qatar",
      "awardedBy" : [ {
        "id" : "ngrid.418818.c",
        "label" : "Qatar Foundation",
        "type" : "Organization"
      } ],
      "contributors" : [ {
        "id" : "n08c7f257",
        "label" : "Guo, Bing"
      } ],
      "coPrincipalInvestigators" : [ {
        "id" : "n08c7f257",
        "label" : "Guo, Bing"
      } ],
      "type" : [ "Grant" ],
      "modTime" : "Fri Mar 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",
      "_links" : {
        "self" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n13af146b"
        },
        "individual" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual{?page,size,sort}",
          "templated" : true
        },
        "export" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n13af146b/export?type=docx"
        }
      }
    }, {
      "id" : "na971ae5b",
      "class" : "Relationship",
      "title" : "The Early Reading Intervention: Examination of Curriculum Efficacy, Durability, and Intensity",
      "awardedBy" : [ {
        "id" : "ngrid.419881.d",
        "label" : "United States Department of Education",
        "type" : "Organization"
      } ],
      "contributors" : [ {
        "id" : "nb2c12cd3",
        "label" : "Hagan-Burke, Shanna"
      } ],
      "coPrincipalInvestigators" : [ {
        "id" : "nb2c12cd3",
        "label" : "Hagan-Burke, Shanna"
      } ],
      "dateTimeIntervalStart" : "Sun Jan 01 00:00:00 UTC 2006",
      "dateTimeIntervalEnd" : "Sat Jan 01 00:00:00 UTC 2011",
      "type" : [ "Grant" ],
      "modTime" : "Fri Feb 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",
      "_links" : {
        "self" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/na971ae5b"
        },
        "individual" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual{?page,size,sort}",
          "templated" : true
        },
        "export" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/na971ae5b/export?type=docx"
        }
      }
    }, {
      "id" : "nf32a4434",
      "class" : "Relationship",
      "title" : "Metadata design award (test) (Lee, Dong Joon)",
      "receiptOf" : [ {
        "id" : "nc7b1101c",
        "label" : "Metadata design award (test)"
      } ],
      "awardConferredBy" : [ {
        "id" : "n545e2322",
        "label" : "Accounting",
        "type" : "Organization"
      }, {
        "id" : "na420643f",
        "label" : "ABB (Finland)",
        "type" : "otherUniversity"
      } ],
      "yearAwarded" : "Fri Jan 01 00:00:00 UTC 2010",
      "type" : [ "AwardReceipt" ],
      "modTime" : "Tue Jan 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",
      "_links" : {
        "self" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/nf32a4434"
        },
        "individual" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual{?page,size,sort}",
          "templated" : true
        },
        "export" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/nf32a4434/export?type=docx"
        }
      }
    } ]
  },
  "_links" : {
    "self" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/search/advanced?page=1&size=20&sort=id,asc"
    }
  },
  "facets" : [ {
    "field" : "type",
    "entries" : {
      "content" : [ {
        "value" : "grant",
        "count" : 2,
        "valueKey" : "grant"
      }, {
        "value" : "awardreceipt",
        "count" : 1,
        "valueKey" : "awardreceipt"
      } ],
      "page" : {
        "size" : 10,
        "totalElements" : 2,
        "totalPages" : 1,
        "number" : 1
      }
    }
  } ],
  "highlights" : [ ],
  "page" : {
    "size" : 20,
    "totalElements" : 3,
    "totalPages" : 1,
    "number" : 1
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/advanced?q=*%3A*&df=_text_&facets=type&type.limit=5&type.offset=0&type.sort=COUNT&filters=class&class.filter=Relationship&page=0&size=20&sort=id' -i -X GET

1.7.5. Export Search

This export will return a stream of specified type containing the search results with the requested fields, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+query+

The search query

+type+

The search export format type

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.

+export+

The search export fields
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/export?query=*&type=csv&filters=class&class.filter=Relationship&export=id%2CId&export=type%2CType&export=individual%2CIndividual HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Disposition: attachment; filename=export.csv
Content-Type: text/csv
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 198

Id,Type,Individual
n13af146b,Grant,http://localhost:4200/display/n13af146b
na971ae5b,Grant,http://localhost:4200/display/na971ae5b
nf32a4434,AwardReceipt,http://localhost:4200/display/nf32a4434
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/export?query=*&type=csv&filters=class&class.filter=Relationship&export=id%2CId&export=type%2CType&export=individual%2CIndividual' -i -X GET

1.7.6. Export Single Page

This export will return a stream of specified type containing the single page built from the associated export view. An export view must be added to the display view for the type of relationship.

Path Parameters
Table 14. /individual/{id}/export
Parameter Description

+id+

The individual id
Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+type+

The single page export format type
Sample Request
GET /individual/n13af146b/export?type=docx HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/n13af146b/export?type=docx' -i -X GET

1.7.7. Count

This count will return a json response containing the count, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+q+

The search query.

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+value+

+Number+

The resulting count.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/count?q=*%3A*&filters=class&class.filter=Relationship HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 17

{
  "value" : 3
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/count?q=*%3A*&filters=class&class.filter=Relationship' -i -X GET

1.7.8. Recently Updated

This will return a json response listing recently updated relationships, based on the query parameters as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+limit+

The number of recently updated documents to return.

+filters+

The filter fields.

+class.filter+

Class filter value.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+_embedded.individual+

+Array+

An array of Relationship resources.
Sample Request
GET /individual/search/recentlyUpdated?limit=2&filters=class&class.filter=Relationship HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 2160

{
  "_embedded" : {
    "individual" : [ {
      "id" : "n13af146b",
      "class" : "Relationship",
      "title" : "Liquid-Fuel Combustion at Engine Conditions Using Laminar Flames and an Aerosol Shock Tube in Qatar",
      "awardedBy" : [ {
        "id" : "ngrid.418818.c",
        "label" : "Qatar Foundation",
        "type" : "Organization"
      } ],
      "contributors" : [ {
        "id" : "n08c7f257",
        "label" : "Guo, Bing"
      } ],
      "coPrincipalInvestigators" : [ {
        "id" : "n08c7f257",
        "label" : "Guo, Bing"
      } ],
      "type" : [ "Grant" ],
      "modTime" : "Fri Mar 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",
      "_links" : {
        "self" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n13af146b"
        },
        "individual" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual{?page,size,sort}",
          "templated" : true
        },
        "export" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/n13af146b/export?type=docx"
        }
      }
    }, {
      "id" : "na971ae5b",
      "class" : "Relationship",
      "title" : "The Early Reading Intervention: Examination of Curriculum Efficacy, Durability, and Intensity",
      "awardedBy" : [ {
        "id" : "ngrid.419881.d",
        "label" : "United States Department of Education",
        "type" : "Organization"
      } ],
      "contributors" : [ {
        "id" : "nb2c12cd3",
        "label" : "Hagan-Burke, Shanna"
      } ],
      "coPrincipalInvestigators" : [ {
        "id" : "nb2c12cd3",
        "label" : "Hagan-Burke, Shanna"
      } ],
      "dateTimeIntervalStart" : "Sun Jan 01 00:00:00 UTC 2006",
      "dateTimeIntervalEnd" : "Sat Jan 01 00:00:00 UTC 2011",
      "type" : [ "Grant" ],
      "modTime" : "Fri Feb 01 00:00:00 UTC 2019",
      "_links" : {
        "self" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/na971ae5b"
        },
        "individual" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual{?page,size,sort}",
          "templated" : true
        },
        "export" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/individual/na971ae5b/export?type=docx"
        }
      }
    } ]
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/individual/search/recentlyUpdated?limit=2&filters=class&class.filter=Relationship' -i -X GET

2. Registration

This endpoint helps an expertise/scholar to create his/her profile using this system.

2.1. Submit

User is required to enter first name, last name and an email address to submit the registration form. This creates a new token and an email, using the email address provided in the registraion form, is sent to the user. A new user object is then created with a specific role assigned. Clicking on the email link will confirm the user’s email provided.

2.1.1. Request Parameters

Path Type Description

+firstName+

+String+

The first name of the registered account. Size must be between 2 and 64 inclusive.

+lastName+

+String+

The last name of the registered account. Size must be between 2 and 64 inclusive.

+email+

+String+

The e-mail address of the registered account.

2.1.2. Sample Request

POST /registration HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8
Content-Length: 72
Host: localhost:8080

{"firstName":"Bob","lastName":"Boring","email":"bboring@mailinator.com"}

2.1.3. Sample Response

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 72

{"firstName":"Bob","lastName":"Boring","email":"bboring@mailinator.com"}

2.1.4. CURL Sample

$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/registration' -i -X POST \
    -H 'Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8' \
    -d '{"firstName":"Bob","lastName":"Boring","email":"bboring@mailinator.com"}'

2.2. Confirm

This endpoint requires a key string, (obtained when the user clicks on the email confirmation link) which verifies the user token. This key string constructs a token by obtaining user-specified extended information associated with the token, when it was first created. If the user is found and the token is not expired, a user object (as shown in "Sample Response") is returned.

2.2.1. Request Parameters

Parameter Description

+key+

The registration verification key.

2.2.2. Sample Request

GET /registration?key=bboring%40mailinator.com HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080

2.2.3. Sample Response

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 72

{"firstName":"Bob","lastName":"Boring","email":"bboring@mailinator.com"}

2.2.4. CURL Sample

$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/registration?key=bboring%40mailinator.com' -i -X GET

2.3. Complete

This endpoint requires the registration object. Once the user creates a new password and confirms it, the user object is constructed using the email from the registration object. If the account is found, then this endpoint will return a user with an enabled account.

2.3.1. Request Parameters

Path Type Description

+firstName+

+String+

The first name of the registered account. Size must be between 2 and 64 inclusive.

+lastName+

+String+

The last name of the registered account. Size must be between 2 and 64 inclusive.

+email+

+String+

The e-mail address of the registered account.

+password+

+String+

The password for the registered account.

+confirm+

+String+

The password confirmation, which should match the password.

2.3.2. Sample Request

PUT /registration?key=bboring%40mailinator.com HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8
Content-Length: 127
Host: localhost:8080

{"firstName":"Bob","lastName":"Boring","email":"bboring@mailinator.com","password":"HelloWorld123!","confirm":"HelloWorld123!"}

2.3.3. Sample Response

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 134

{"id":3,"firstName":"Bob","lastName":"Boring","email":"bboring@mailinator.com","role":"ROLE_SUPER_ADMIN","active":true,"enabled":true}

2.3.4. CURL Sample

$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/registration?key=bboring%40mailinator.com' -i -X PUT \
    -H 'Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8' \
    -d '{"firstName":"Bob","lastName":"Boring","email":"bboring@mailinator.com","password":"HelloWorld123!","confirm":"HelloWorld123!"}'

3. Login

This endpoint allows the registered user to log in using his/her username and password.

3.1. Request Parameters

Parameter Description

+username+

The username to login as, usually an e-mail address.

+password+

The password associated with the specified username.

3.2. Response Fields

Path Type Description

+id+

+Number+

The ID of the user.

+firstName+

+String+

The first name of the user. Must not be null. Size must be between 2 and 64 inclusive.

+lastName+

+String+

The last name of the user. Must not be null. Size must be between 2 and 64 inclusive.

+email+

+String+

The e-mail address of the user. Must be a well-formed email address. Must not be null.

+role+

+String+

The authorization role of the user. Must not be null.

+active+

+Boolean+

The expired/unexpired status of the user.

+enabled+

+Boolean+

The locked/unlocked status of the user.

3.3. Sample Request

POST /login HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

username=bboring%40mailinator.com&password=HelloWorld123%21

3.4. Sample Response

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Set-Cookie: SESSION=YTM1M2IwNDYtN2U5Yi00NWZlLTgwM2ItZGM4YzU2ZTNkODJh; Path=/; SameSite=Lax
Content-Length: 128

{"id":21,"firstName":"Bob","lastName":"Boring","email":"bboring@mailinator.com","role":"ROLE_USER","active":true,"enabled":true}

3.5. CURL Sample

$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/login' -i -X POST \
    -d 'username=bboring%40mailinator.com&password=HelloWorld123%21'

4. Logout

This endpoint allows the authenticated user to log out.

4.1. Sample Request

POST /logout HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Cookie: SESSION=YTNlYzMwMGQtN2U5Zi00OTM4LTg1NmMtNmE5M2VlOTc1ZDUw

4.2. Sample Response

HTTP/1.1 205 Reset Content
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Set-Cookie: remove=; Path=/; Max-Age=0; Expires=Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT
Set-Cookie: SESSION=; Path=/; Max-Age=0; Expires=Thu, 1 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT; SameSite=Lax
Set-Cookie: SESSION=; Path=/; Max-Age=0; Expires=Thu, 1 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT; SameSite=Lax
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 7

Success

4.3. CURL Sample

$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/logout' -i -X POST \
    --cookie 'SESSION=YTNlYzMwMGQtN2U5Zi00OTM4LTg1NmMtNmE5M2VlOTc1ZDUw'

5. User

This endpoint returns the authenticated user.

5.1. Response Fields

Path Type Description

+id+

+Number+

The ID of the user.

+firstName+

+String+

The first name of the user. Must not be null. Size must be between 2 and 64 inclusive.

+lastName+

+String+

The last name of the user. Must not be null. Size must be between 2 and 64 inclusive.

+email+

+String+

The e-mail address of the user. Must be a well-formed email address. Must not be null.

+role+

+String+

The authorization role of the user. Must not be null.

+active+

+Boolean+

The expired/unexpired status of the user.

+enabled+

+Boolean+

The locked/unlocked status of the user.

5.2. Sample Request

GET /user HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Cookie: SESSION=Mzg1NTc2ODAtODhkZC00MWNlLWFiYzYtNTU4NDUyMDZjZmFm

5.3. Sample Response

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 129

{"id":25,"firstName":"Bob","lastName":"Boring","email":"bboring@mailinator.com","role":"ROLE_ADMIN","active":true,"enabled":true}

5.4. CURL Sample

$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/user' -i -X GET \
    --cookie 'SESSION=Mzg1NTc2ODAtODhkZC00MWNlLWFiYzYtNTU4NDUyMDZjZmFm'

6. Administration

6.1. Directory Views

This section describes about the directory views of the application. This object is a persistent representation of a directory UI.

6.1.1. Directory

This displays a list of all the directory view objects based on parameters like page, size or sort feature based on name, collection etc as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+page+

The page number.

+size+

The page size.

+sort+

The page sort.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+_embedded.directoryViews+

+Array+

An array of Directory View resources.

+_links+

+Object+

Links to other resources.

+page+

+Object+

Page details for Directory View resources.
Sample Request
GET /directoryViews?page=0&size=20&sort=name HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 1643

{
  "_embedded" : {
    "directoryViews" : [ {
      "name" : "People",
      "layout" : "LIST",
      "templates" : {
        "default" : "<h1>Person template from WSYWIG</h1>"
      },
      "styles" : [ "color: maroon;" ],
      "fields" : [ "title" ],
      "facets" : [ {
        "name" : "Name",
        "field" : "name",
        "opKey" : "EQUALS",
        "type" : "STRING",
        "sort" : "COUNT",
        "direction" : "DESC",
        "pageSize" : 20,
        "pageNumber" : 1,
        "collapsed" : true,
        "hidden" : false
      } ],
      "filters" : [ {
        "field" : "type",
        "value" : "FacultyMember",
        "opKey" : "EQUALS"
      } ],
      "boosts" : [ {
        "field" : "name",
        "value" : 2.0
      } ],
      "sort" : [ {
        "field" : "name",
        "direction" : "ASC",
        "date" : false
      } ],
      "export" : [ {
        "columnHeader" : "Id",
        "valuePath" : "id"
      }, {
        "columnHeader" : "Name",
        "valuePath" : "name"
      } ],
      "index" : {
        "field" : "name",
        "opKey" : "ENDS_WITH",
        "options" : [ ]
      },
      "_links" : {
        "self" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/directoryViews/3"
        },
        "directoryView" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/directoryViews/3"
        }
      }
    } ]
  },
  "_links" : {
    "self" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/directoryViews"
    },
    "profile" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/profile/directoryViews"
    }
  },
  "page" : {
    "size" : 20,
    "totalElements" : 1,
    "totalPages" : 1,
    "number" : 1
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/directoryViews?page=0&size=20&sort=name' -i -X GET

6.1.2. Create

A directory view is created by adding a fields like name, collection, index etc along with other variables as shown in the Request Fields.

Request Fields
Path Type Description

+name+

+String+

The name of the Directory View. Must not be null. Size must be between 2 and 64 inclusive.

+layout+

+String+

The layout of the Directory View.

+templates+

+Object+

The result templates of the Directory View.

+styles+

+Array+

An array of result style strings of the Directory View.

+fields+

+Array+

An array of fields of the Directory View.

+index+

+Object+

A Index resource.

+facets+

+Array+

An array of Facet resources.

+filters+

+Array+

An array of Filters resources.

+boosts+

+Array+

An array of Boosts resources.

+sort+

+Array+

An array of Sort resources.

+export+

+Array+

An array of Export resources.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+name+

+String+

The name of the Directory View. Must not be null. Size must be between 2 and 64 inclusive.

+layout+

+String+

The layout of the Directory View.

+templates+

+Object+

The result templates of the Directory View.

+styles+

+Array+

An array of result style strings of the Directory View.

+fields+

+Array+

An array of fields of the Directory View.

+index+

+Object+

A Index resource.

+facets+

+Array+

An array of Facet resources.

+filters+

+Array+

An array of Filters resources.

+boosts+

+Array+

An array of Boosts resources.

+sort+

+Array+

An array of Sort resources.

+export+

+Array+

An array of Export resources.

+_links+

+Object+

Links to other resources.
Sample Request
POST /directoryViews HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8
Content-Length: 633
Host: localhost:8080
Cookie: SESSION=NTJmNTg2NmQtZWUxNS00YzVmLTg5ZDgtNDViNTNjNzMyYzIx

{"name":"People","layout":"LIST","templates":{"default":"<h1>Person template from WSYWIG</h1>"},"styles":["color: maroon;"],"fields":["title"],"facets":[{"name":"Name","field":"name","opKey":"EQUALS","type":"STRING","sort":"COUNT","direction":"DESC","pageSize":20,"pageNumber":1,"collapsed":true,"hidden":false}],"filters":[{"field":"type","value":"FacultyMember","opKey":"EQUALS"}],"boosts":[{"field":"name","value":2.0}],"sort":[{"field":"name","direction":"ASC","date":false}],"export":[{"columnHeader":"Id","valuePath":"id"},{"columnHeader":"Name","valuePath":"name"}],"index":{"field":"name","opKey":"ENDS_WITH","options":null}}
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 201 Created
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Location: http://localhost:8080/directoryViews/5
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 1094

{
  "name" : "People",
  "layout" : "LIST",
  "templates" : {
    "default" : "<h1>Person template from WSYWIG</h1>"
  },
  "styles" : [ "color: maroon;" ],
  "fields" : [ "title" ],
  "facets" : [ {
    "name" : "Name",
    "field" : "name",
    "opKey" : "EQUALS",
    "type" : "STRING",
    "sort" : "COUNT",
    "direction" : "DESC",
    "pageSize" : 20,
    "pageNumber" : 1,
    "collapsed" : true,
    "hidden" : false
  } ],
  "filters" : [ {
    "field" : "type",
    "value" : "FacultyMember",
    "opKey" : "EQUALS"
  } ],
  "boosts" : [ {
    "field" : "name",
    "value" : 2.0
  } ],
  "sort" : [ {
    "field" : "name",
    "direction" : "ASC",
    "date" : false
  } ],
  "export" : [ {
    "columnHeader" : "Id",
    "valuePath" : "id"
  }, {
    "columnHeader" : "Name",
    "valuePath" : "name"
  } ],
  "index" : {
    "field" : "name",
    "opKey" : "ENDS_WITH",
    "options" : null
  },
  "_links" : {
    "self" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/directoryViews/5"
    },
    "directoryView" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/directoryViews/5"
    }
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/directoryViews' -i -X POST \
    -H 'Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8' \
    --cookie 'SESSION=NTJmNTg2NmQtZWUxNS00YzVmLTg5ZDgtNDViNTNjNzMyYzIx' \
    -d '{"name":"People","layout":"LIST","templates":{"default":"<h1>Person template from WSYWIG</h1>"},"styles":["color: maroon;"],"fields":["title"],"facets":[{"name":"Name","field":"name","opKey":"EQUALS","type":"STRING","sort":"COUNT","direction":"DESC","pageSize":20,"pageNumber":1,"collapsed":true,"hidden":false}],"filters":[{"field":"type","value":"FacultyMember","opKey":"EQUALS"}],"boosts":[{"field":"name","value":2.0}],"sort":[{"field":"name","direction":"ASC","date":false}],"export":[{"columnHeader":"Id","valuePath":"id"},{"columnHeader":"Name","valuePath":"name"}],"index":{"field":"name","opKey":"ENDS_WITH","options":null}}'

6.1.3. Delete

A directory view can be deleted by passing the directoryView id as a path parameter. This will return a NO_CONTENT (204) http status code as shown in the Sample Response.

Path Parameters
Table 15. /directoryViews/{id}
Parameter Description

+id+

The Directory View id
Sample Request
DELETE /directoryViews/1 HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Cookie: SESSION=NjFiYTFhY2EtY2YyZi00ZjYwLThkYTItMDcyOWMxMzI5ZWMy
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 204 No Content
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/directoryViews/1' -i -X DELETE \
    --cookie 'SESSION=NjFiYTFhY2EtY2YyZi00ZjYwLThkYTItMDcyOWMxMzI5ZWMy'

6.1.4. Find by Id

A user can find a directory view by providing directoryView id as a path parameter. This returns a json response displaying the HttpStatus.OK(200) message along with the directory view object as shown in the Sample Response.

Path Parameters
Table 16. /directoryViews/{id}
Parameter Description

+id+

The Theme id.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+name+

+String+

The name of the Directory View. Must not be null. Size must be between 2 and 64 inclusive.

+layout+

+String+

The layout of the Directory View.

+templates+

+Object+

The result templates of the Directory View.

+styles+

+Array+

An array of result style strings of the Directory View.

+fields+

+Array+

An array of fields of the Directory View.

+index+

+Object+

A Index resource.

+facets+

+Array+

An array of Facet resources.

+filters+

+Array+

An array of Filters resources.

+boosts+

+Array+

An array of Boosts resources.

+sort+

+Array+

An array of Sort resources.

+export+

+Array+

An array of Export resources.

+_links+

+Object+

Links to other resources.
Sample Request
GET /directoryViews/2 HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 1093

{
  "name" : "People",
  "layout" : "LIST",
  "templates" : {
    "default" : "<h1>Person template from WSYWIG</h1>"
  },
  "styles" : [ "color: maroon;" ],
  "fields" : [ "title" ],
  "facets" : [ {
    "name" : "Name",
    "field" : "name",
    "opKey" : "EQUALS",
    "type" : "STRING",
    "sort" : "COUNT",
    "direction" : "DESC",
    "pageSize" : 20,
    "pageNumber" : 1,
    "collapsed" : true,
    "hidden" : false
  } ],
  "filters" : [ {
    "field" : "type",
    "value" : "FacultyMember",
    "opKey" : "EQUALS"
  } ],
  "boosts" : [ {
    "field" : "name",
    "value" : 2.0
  } ],
  "sort" : [ {
    "field" : "name",
    "direction" : "ASC",
    "date" : false
  } ],
  "export" : [ {
    "columnHeader" : "Id",
    "valuePath" : "id"
  }, {
    "columnHeader" : "Name",
    "valuePath" : "name"
  } ],
  "index" : {
    "field" : "name",
    "opKey" : "ENDS_WITH",
    "options" : [ ]
  },
  "_links" : {
    "self" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/directoryViews/2"
    },
    "directoryView" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/directoryViews/2"
    }
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/directoryViews/2' -i -X GET

6.1.5. Patch

This helps an admin user to partially update a directory view. This process utilizes the http patch protocol.

Path Parameters
Table 17. /directoryViews/{id}
Parameter Description

+id+

The Directory View id.
Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+id+

The Directory View id.

+name+

The name of the Directory View. Must not be null. Size must be between 2 and 64 inclusive.

+layout+

The layout of the Directory View.

+index+

A Index resource.

+templates+

The result templates of the Directory View.

+styles+

An array of result style strings of the Directory View.

+fields+

An array of fields of the Directory View.

+facets+

An array of Facet resources.

+filters+

An array of Filters resources.

+boosts+

An array of Boosts resources.

+sort+

An array of Sort resources.

+export+

An array of Export resources.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+name+

+String+

The name of the Directory View. Must not be null. Size must be between 2 and 64 inclusive.

+layout+

+String+

The layout of the Directory View.

+templates+

+Object+

The result templates of the Directory View.

+styles+

+Array+

An array of result style strings of the Directory View.

+fields+

+Array+

An array of fields of the Directory View.

+index+

+Object+

A Index resource.

+facets+

+Array+

An array of Facet resources.

+filters+

+Array+

An array of Filters resources.

+boosts+

+Array+

An array of Boosts resources.

+sort+

+Array+

An array of Sort resources.

+export+

+Array+

An array of Export resources.

+_links+

+Object+

Links to other resources.
Sample Request
PATCH /directoryViews/6 HTTP/1.1
Content-Length: 25
Host: localhost:8080
Cookie: SESSION=NGNmNTBkODQtNzI1My00Y2E2LWE3MWUtOGExODQ4OTUzNzQ1

{"name": "Organizations"}
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 1100

{
  "name" : "Organizations",
  "layout" : "LIST",
  "templates" : {
    "default" : "<h1>Person template from WSYWIG</h1>"
  },
  "styles" : [ "color: maroon;" ],
  "fields" : [ "title" ],
  "facets" : [ {
    "name" : "Name",
    "field" : "name",
    "opKey" : "EQUALS",
    "type" : "STRING",
    "sort" : "COUNT",
    "direction" : "DESC",
    "pageSize" : 20,
    "pageNumber" : 1,
    "collapsed" : true,
    "hidden" : false
  } ],
  "filters" : [ {
    "field" : "type",
    "value" : "FacultyMember",
    "opKey" : "EQUALS"
  } ],
  "boosts" : [ {
    "field" : "name",
    "value" : 2.0
  } ],
  "sort" : [ {
    "field" : "name",
    "direction" : "ASC",
    "date" : false
  } ],
  "export" : [ {
    "columnHeader" : "Id",
    "valuePath" : "id"
  }, {
    "columnHeader" : "Name",
    "valuePath" : "name"
  } ],
  "index" : {
    "field" : "name",
    "opKey" : "ENDS_WITH",
    "options" : [ ]
  },
  "_links" : {
    "self" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/directoryViews/6"
    },
    "directoryView" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/directoryViews/6"
    }
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/directoryViews/6' -i -X PATCH \
    --cookie 'SESSION=NGNmNTBkODQtNzI1My00Y2E2LWE3MWUtOGExODQ4OTUzNzQ1' \
    -d '{"name": "Organizations"}'

6.1.6. Update

This helps an admin user to update a specifc directory view based on the directoryView id provided in the path parameter. This utilizes the http put protocol.

Path Parameters
Table 18. /directoryViews/{id}
Parameter Description

+id+

The Directory View id.
Request Fields
Path Type Description

+id+

+Number+

The Directory View id.

+name+

+String+

The name of the Directory View. Must not be null. Size must be between 2 and 64 inclusive.

+layout+

+String+

The layout of the Directory View.

+templates+

+Object+

The result templates of the Directory View.

+styles+

+Array+

An array of result style strings of the Directory View.

+fields+

+Array+

An array of fields of the Directory View.

+index+

+Object+

A Index resource.

+facets+

+Array+

An array of Facet resources.

+filters+

+Array+

An array of Filters resources.

+boosts+

+Array+

An array of Boosts resources.

+sort+

+Array+

An array of Sort resources.

+export+

+Array+

An array of Export resources.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+name+

+String+

The name of the Directory View. Must not be null. Size must be between 2 and 64 inclusive.

+layout+

+String+

The layout of the Directory View.

+templates+

+Object+

The result templates of the Directory View.

+styles+

+Array+

An array of result style strings of the Directory View.

+fields+

+Array+

An array of fields of the Directory View.

+index+

+Object+

A Index resource.

+facets+

+Array+

An array of Facet resources.

+filters+

+Array+

An array of Filters resources.

+boosts+

+Array+

An array of Boosts resources.

+sort+

+Array+

An array of Sort resources.

+export+

+Array+

An array of Export resources.

+_links+

+Object+

Links to other resources.
Sample Request
PUT /directoryViews/4 HTTP/1.1
Content-Length: 645
Host: localhost:8080
Cookie: SESSION=YmM0MmIzNzktNmE3Yy00NWM3LTg1ODQtMTg3NGNlOTZkMzNm

{"id":4,"name":"Organizations","layout":"LIST","templates":{"default":"<h1>Person template from WSYWIG</h1>"},"styles":["color: maroon;"],"fields":["title"],"facets":[{"name":"Name","field":"name","opKey":"EQUALS","type":"STRING","sort":"COUNT","direction":"DESC","pageSize":20,"pageNumber":1,"collapsed":true,"hidden":false}],"filters":[{"field":"type","value":"FacultyMember","opKey":"EQUALS"}],"boosts":[{"field":"name","value":2.0}],"sort":[{"field":"name","direction":"ASC","date":false}],"export":[{"columnHeader":"Id","valuePath":"id"},{"columnHeader":"Name","valuePath":"name"}],"index":{"field":"name","opKey":"ENDS_WITH","options":[]}}
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Location: http://localhost:8080/directoryViews/4
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 1100

{
  "name" : "Organizations",
  "layout" : "LIST",
  "templates" : {
    "default" : "<h1>Person template from WSYWIG</h1>"
  },
  "styles" : [ "color: maroon;" ],
  "fields" : [ "title" ],
  "facets" : [ {
    "name" : "Name",
    "field" : "name",
    "opKey" : "EQUALS",
    "type" : "STRING",
    "sort" : "COUNT",
    "direction" : "DESC",
    "pageSize" : 20,
    "pageNumber" : 1,
    "collapsed" : true,
    "hidden" : false
  } ],
  "filters" : [ {
    "field" : "type",
    "value" : "FacultyMember",
    "opKey" : "EQUALS"
  } ],
  "boosts" : [ {
    "field" : "name",
    "value" : 2.0
  } ],
  "sort" : [ {
    "field" : "name",
    "direction" : "ASC",
    "date" : false
  } ],
  "export" : [ {
    "columnHeader" : "Id",
    "valuePath" : "id"
  }, {
    "columnHeader" : "Name",
    "valuePath" : "name"
  } ],
  "index" : {
    "field" : "name",
    "opKey" : "ENDS_WITH",
    "options" : [ ]
  },
  "_links" : {
    "self" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/directoryViews/4"
    },
    "directoryView" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/directoryViews/4"
    }
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/directoryViews/4' -i -X PUT \
    --cookie 'SESSION=YmM0MmIzNzktNmE3Yy00NWM3LTg1ODQtMTg3NGNlOTZkMzNm' \
    -d '{"id":4,"name":"Organizations","layout":"LIST","templates":{"default":"<h1>Person template from WSYWIG</h1>"},"styles":["color: maroon;"],"fields":["title"],"facets":[{"name":"Name","field":"name","opKey":"EQUALS","type":"STRING","sort":"COUNT","direction":"DESC","pageSize":20,"pageNumber":1,"collapsed":true,"hidden":false}],"filters":[{"field":"type","value":"FacultyMember","opKey":"EQUALS"}],"boosts":[{"field":"name","value":2.0}],"sort":[{"field":"name","direction":"ASC","date":false}],"export":[{"columnHeader":"Id","valuePath":"id"},{"columnHeader":"Name","valuePath":"name"}],"index":{"field":"name","opKey":"ENDS_WITH","options":[]}}'

6.2. Discovery Views

This section describes about the discovery views of the application. This object is a persistent representation of a discovery view.

6.2.1. Directory

This displays a list of all the discovery view objects based on parameters like page, size or sort feature based on name, collection etc as shown in Request Parameters.

Request Parameters
Parameter Description

+page+

The page number.

+size+

The page size.

+sort+

The page sort.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+_embedded.discoveryViews+

+Array+

An array of Discovery View resources.

+_links+

+Object+

Links to other resources.

+page+

+Object+

Page details for Discovery View resources.
Sample Request
GET /discoveryViews?page=0&size=20&sort=name HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8080
Sample Response
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Vary: Origin
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Method
Vary: Access-Control-Request-Headers
Content-Type: application/hal+json
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Content-Length: 1688

{
  "_embedded" : {
    "discoveryViews" : [ {
      "name" : "People",
      "layout" : "GRID",
      "templates" : {
        "default" : "<h1>Person template from WSYWIG</h1>"
      },
      "styles" : [ "color: maroon;" ],
      "fields" : [ "title" ],
      "facets" : [ {
        "name" : "Name",
        "field" : "name",
        "opKey" : "EQUALS",
        "type" : "STRING",
        "sort" : "COUNT",
        "direction" : "DESC",
        "pageSize" : 20,
        "pageNumber" : 1,
        "collapsed" : true,
        "hidden" : false
      } ],
      "filters" : [ {
        "field" : "type",
        "value" : "FacultyMember",
        "opKey" : "EQUALS"
      } ],
      "boosts" : [ {
        "field" : "name",
        "value" : 2.0
      } ],
      "sort" : [ {
        "field" : "name",
        "direction" : "ASC",
        "date" : false
      } ],
      "export" : [ {
        "columnHeader" : "Id",
        "valuePath" : "id"
      }, {
        "columnHeader" : "Name",
        "valuePath" : "name"
      } ],
      "defaultSearchField" : "overview",
      "highlightFields" : [ "overview" ],
      "highlightPrefix" : "<em>",
      "highlightPostfix" : "</em>",
      "_links" : {
        "self" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/discoveryViews/4"
        },
        "discoveryView" : {
          "href" : "http://localhost:8080/discoveryViews/4"
        }
      }
    } ]
  },
  "_links" : {
    "self" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/discoveryViews"
    },
    "profile" : {
      "href" : "http://localhost:8080/profile/discoveryViews"
    }
  },
  "page" : {
    "size" : 20,
    "totalElements" : 1,
    "totalPages" : 1,
    "number" : 1
  }
}
CURL Sample
$ curl 'http://localhost:8080/discoveryViews?page=0&size=20&sort=name' -i -X GET

6.2.2. Create

A discovery view is created by adding a fields like name, collection, resultView, facets, filters etc along with other variables as shown in the Request Fields.

Request Fields
Path Type Description

+name+

+String+

The name of the Discovery View. Must not be null. Size must be between 2 and 64 inclusive.

+layout+

+String+

The layout of the Discovery View.

+templates+

+Object+

The result templates of the Discovery View.

+styles+

+Array+

An array of result style strings of the Discovery View.

+fields+

+Array+

An array of fields of the Discovery View.

+facets+

+Array+

An array of Facet resources.

+filters+

+Array+

An array of Filters resources.

+boosts+

+Array+

An array of Boosts resources.

+sort+

+Array+

An array of Sort resources.

+export+

+Array+

An array of Export resources.

+defaultSearchField+

+String+

The default search field of the Discovery View.

+highlightFields+

+Array+

An array of highlight fields of the Discovery View.

+highlightPrefix+

+String+

The highlight prefix of the Discovery View.

+highlightPostfix+

+String+

The highlight postfix of the Discovery View.
Response Fields
Path Type Description

+name+

+String+

The name of the Discovery View. Must not be null. Size must be between 2 and 64 inclusive.

+layout+

+String+

The layout of the Discovery View.

+templates+

+Object+

The result templates of the Discovery View.

+styles+

+Array+

An array of result style strings of the Discovery View.

+fields+

+Array+

An array of fields of the Discovery View.

+facets+

+Array+

An array of Facet resources.

+filters+

+Array+

An array of Filters resources.

+boosts+

+Array+

An array of Boosts resources.

+sort+

+Array+

An array of Sort resources.

+export+

+Array+

An array of Export resources.

+defaultSearchField+

+String+

The default search field of the Discovery View.

+highlightFields+

+Array+

An array of highlight fields of the Discovery View.

+highlightPrefix+

+String+

The highlight prefix of the Discovery View.

+highlightPostfix+

+String+

The highlight postfix of the Discovery View.

+_links+

+Object+

Links to other resources.
